   21: -module(process_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: %% Tests processes, trapping exit messages and the BIFs:
   24: %% 	exit/1
   25: %%	exit/2
   26: %%	process_info/1,2
   27: %%	register/2 (partially)
   28:

   30: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   31: 
   32: -define(heap_binary_size, 64).
   33: 
   34: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   35: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2, spawn_with_binaries/1,

   47:          process_info_garbage_collection/1,

  116: suite() ->
  117:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
  118:      {timetrap, {minutes, 9}}].

  120: all() ->
  121:     [spawn_with_binaries, t_exit_1, {group, t_exit_2},
  122:      trap_exit_badarg, trap_exit_badarg_in_bif,
  123:      bump_reductions, low_prio, yield, yield2, otp_4725,
  124:      dist_unlink_ack_exit_leak, bad_register, garbage_collect,
  125:      process_flag_badarg,
  126:      process_flag_fullsweep_after, process_flag_heap_size,
  127:      command_line_max_heap_size,
  128:      spawn_opt_heap_size, spawn_opt_max_heap_size,
  129:      spawn_huge_arglist,
  130:      otp_6237,
  131:      {group, spawn_request},
  132:      {group, process_info_bif},
  133:      {group, processes_bif},
  134:      {group, otp_7738}, garb_other_running,
  135:      {group, system_task},

  140: groups() -> 
  141:     [{t_exit_2, [],

  143:        normal_suicide_exit, abnormal_suicide_exit,
  144:        t_exit_2_catch, exit_and_timeout, exit_twice]},
  145:      {spawn_request, [],
  146:       [spawn_request_bif,
  147:        spawn_request_monitor_demonitor,
  148:        spawn_request_monitor_child_exit,
  149:        spawn_request_link_child_exit,

  151:        spawn_request_link_parent_exit_compound_reason,

  167:       [t_process_info, process_info_messages,
  168:        process_info_other, process_info_other_msg,
  169:        process_info_other_message_queue_len_signal_race,
  170:        process_info_other_dist_msg, process_info_other_status,
  171:        process_info_2_list,

  198: 
  199: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  200:     A0 = case application:start(sasl) of
  201: 	     ok -> [sasl];
  202: 	     _ -> []
  203: 	 end,
  204:     A = case application:start(os_mon) of
  205: 	     ok -> [os_mon|A0];
  206: 	     _ -> A0
  207: 	 end,
  208:     [{started_apps, A}|Config].
  209: 
  210: end_per_suite(Config) ->
  211:     As = proplists:get_value(started_apps, Config),
  212:     lists:foreach(fun (A) -> application:stop(A) end, As),
  213:     catch erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, false),
  214:     Config.
  215: 
  216: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  217:     Config.
  218: 
  219: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  220:     Config.
  221: 
  222: init_per_testcase(Func, Config)
  223:   when Func =:= processes_default_tab;
  224:        Func =:= processes_this_tab ->
  225:     case erlang:system_info(build_type) of
  226:         BT when BT =:= debug; BT =:= valgrind ->
  227:             {skip, "Don't run in debug/valgrind"};
  228:         _ ->
  229:             [{testcase, Func} | Config]
  230:     end;
  231: init_per_testcase(Func, Config) when is_atom(Func), is_list(Config) ->
  232:     [{testcase, Func}|Config].
  233: 
  234: end_per_testcase(Func, Config) when is_atom(Func), is_list(Config) ->
  235:     %% Restore max_heap_size to default value.
  236:     erlang:system_flag(max_heap_size,
  237:                        #{size => 0,
  238:                          kill => true,
  239:                          include_shared_binaries => false,
  240:                          error_logger => true}),
  241:     erts_test_utils:ept_check_leaked_nodes(Config).
  242: 
  243: fun_spawn(Fun) ->
  244:     spawn_link(erlang, apply, [Fun, []]).
  245: 
  246: %% Tests that binaries as arguments to spawn/3 doesn't leak
  247: %% (unclear if this test case will actually prove anything on
  248: %% a modern computer with lots of memory).
  249: spawn_with_binaries(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  250:     L = lists:duplicate(2048, 42),
  251:     TwoMeg = lists:duplicate(1024, L),
  252:     Fun = fun() -> spawn(?MODULE, binary_owner, [list_to_binary(TwoMeg)]),
  253: 			 receive after 1 -> ok end end,
  254:     Iter = case test_server:is_valgrind() of
  255: 		     true -> 10;
  256: 		     false -> 150
  257: 		 end,
  258:     test_server:do_times(Iter, Fun),
  259:     ok.
  260: 
  261: binary_owner(Bin) when is_binary(Bin) ->
  262:     ok.
  263: 
  264: %% Tests exit/1 with a big message.
  265: t_exit_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  266:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 20}),
  267:     start_spawner(),
  268:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  269:     test_server:do_times(10, fun t_exit_1/0),
  270:     stop_spawner(),
  271:     ok.
  272: 
  273: t_exit_1() ->
  274:     Pid = fun_spawn(fun() -> exit(kb_128()) end),
  275:     Garbage = kb_128(),
  276:     receive
  277: 	      {'EXIT', Pid, Garbage} -> ok
  278: 	  end.
  279: 
  280: 
  281: %% Tests exit/2 with a lot of data in the exit message.
  282: t_exit_2_other(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  283:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 20}),
  284:     start_spawner(),
  285:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  286:     test_server:do_times(10, fun t_exit_2_other/0),
  287:     stop_spawner(),
  288:     ok.
  289: 
  290: t_exit_2_other() ->
  291:     Pid = fun_spawn(fun() -> receive x -> ok end end),
  292:     Garbage = kb_128(),
  293:     exit(Pid, Garbage),
  294:     receive
  295: 	      {'EXIT', Pid, Garbage} -> ok
  296: 	  end.
  297: 
  298: %% Tests that exit(Pid, normal) does not kill another process.;
  299: t_exit_2_other_normal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  300:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 20}),
  301:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  302:     Pid = fun_spawn(fun() -> receive x -> ok end end),
  303:     exit(Pid, normal),
  304:     receive
  305: 	      {'EXIT', Pid, Reason} ->
  306: 		  ct:fail({process_died, Reason})
  307: 	  after 1000 ->
  308: 		  ok
  309: 	  end,
  310:     case process_info(Pid) of
  311: 	      undefined ->
  312: 		  ct:fail(process_died_on_normal);
  313: 	      List when is_list(List) ->
  314: 		  ok
  315: 	  end,
  316:     exit(Pid, kill),
  317:     ok.
  318: 
  319: %% Tests that we can trap an exit message sent with exit/2 from
  320: %% the same process.
  321: self_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  322:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 10}),
  323:     start_spawner(),
  324:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  325:     test_server:do_times(200, fun self_exit/0),
  326:     stop_spawner(),
  327:     ok.
  328: 
  329: self_exit() ->
  330:     Garbage = eight_kb(),
  331:     P = self(),
  332:     true = exit(P, Garbage),
  333:     receive
  334: 	      {'EXIT', P, Garbage} -> ok
  335: 	  end.
  336: 
  337: %% Tests exit(self(), normal) is equivalent to exit(normal) for a process
  338: %% that doesn't trap exits.
  339: normal_suicide_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  340:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  341:     Pid = fun_spawn(fun() -> exit(self(), normal) end),
  342:     receive
  343: 	      {'EXIT', Pid, normal} -> ok;
  344: 	      Other -> ct:fail({bad_message, Other})
  345: 	  end.
  346: 
  347: %% Tests exit(self(), Term) is equivalent to exit(Term) for a process
  348: %% that doesn't trap exits.";
  349: abnormal_suicide_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  350:     Garbage = eight_kb(),
  351:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  352:     Pid = fun_spawn(fun() -> exit(self(), Garbage) end),
  353:     receive
  354: 	      {'EXIT', Pid, Garbage} -> ok;
  355: 	      Other -> ct:fail({bad_message, Other})
  356: 	  end.
  357: 
  358: %% Tests that exit(self(), die) cannot be caught.
  359: t_exit_2_catch(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  360:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  361:     Pid = fun_spawn(fun() -> catch exit(self(), die) end),
  362:     receive
  363: 	      {'EXIT', Pid, normal} ->
  364: 		  ct:fail(catch_worked);
  365: 	      {'EXIT', Pid, die} ->
  366: 		  ok;
  367: 	      Other ->
  368: 		  ct:fail({bad_message, Other})
  369: 	  end.
  370: 
  371: %% Tests trapping of an 'EXIT' message generated by a bad argument to
  372: %% the abs/1 bif.  The 'EXIT' message will intentionally be very big.
  373: trap_exit_badarg(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  374:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 10}),
  375:     start_spawner(),
  376:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  377:     try
  378:         %% suppress  =ERROR REPORT=== emulator messages
  379:         ok = logger:add_primary_filter(suppress_log_spam, {
  380:             fun(#{meta := #{error_logger := #{emulator := true, tag := error}}}, _Report) ->
  381:                 stop;
  382:             (_Meta, _Report) ->
  383:                 ignore
  384:             end, ok}),
  385:         test_server:do_times(10, fun trap_exit_badarg/0),
  386:         ct:sleep(500) %% flush logging
  387:     after
  388:         ok = logger:remove_primary_filter(suppress_log_spam)
  389:     end,
  390:     stop_spawner(),
  391:     ok.
  392: 
  393: trap_exit_badarg() ->
  394:     Pid = fun_spawn(fun() -> bad_guy(kb_128()) end),
  395:     Garbage = kb_128(),
  396:     receive
  397: 	      {'EXIT',Pid,{badarg,[{erlang,abs,[Garbage],Loc1},
  398: 				   {?MODULE,bad_guy,1,Loc2}|_]}}
  399: 	      when is_list(Loc1), is_list(Loc2) ->
  400: 		  ok;
  401: 	      Other ->
  402: 		  ok = io:format("Bad EXIT message: ~P", [Other, 30]),
  403: 		  ct:fail(bad_exit_message)
  404: 	  end.
  405: 
  406: bad_guy(Arg) ->
  407:     abs(Arg).
  408: 
  409: 
  410: kb_128() ->
  411:     Eight = eight_kb(),
  412:     {big_binary(),
  413:      Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight,
  414:      big_binary(),
  415:      Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight,
  416:      big_binary()}.
  417: 
  418: eight_kb() ->
  419:     B64 = lists:seq(1, 64),
  420:     B512 = {<<1>>,B64,<<2,3>>,B64,make_unaligned_sub_binary(<<4,5,6,7,8,9>>),
  421: 		  B64,make_sub_binary([1,2,3,4,5,6]),
  422: 		  B64,make_sub_binary(lists:seq(1, ?heap_binary_size+1)),
  423: 		  B64,B64,B64,B64,big_binary()},
  424:     lists:duplicate(8, {B512,B512}).
  425: 
  426: big_binary() ->
  427:     big_binary(10, [42]).
  428: big_binary(0, Acc) ->
  429:     list_to_binary(Acc);
  430: big_binary(N, Acc) ->
  431:     big_binary(N-1, [Acc|Acc]).
  432: 
  433: %% Test receiving an EXIT message when spawning a BIF with bad arguments.
  434: trap_exit_badarg_in_bif(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  435:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 10}),
  436:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  437:     test_server:do_times(10, fun trap_exit_badarg_bif/0),
  438:     ok.
  439:     
  440: trap_exit_badarg_bif() ->
  441:     Pid = spawn_link(erlang, node, [1]),
  442:     receive
  443: 	      {'EXIT', Pid, {badarg, _}} ->
  444: 		  ok;
  445: 	      Other ->
  446: 		  ct:fail({unexpected, Other})
  447: 	  end.
  448: 
  449: %% The following sequences of events have crasched Beam.
  450: %%
  451: %% 1) An exit is sent to a process which is currently not running.
  452: %%    The exit reason will (on purpose) overwrite the message queue
  453: %%    pointer.
  454: %% 2) Before the process is scheduled in, it receives a timeout (from
  455: %%    a 'receive after').
  456: %% 3) The process will crash the next time it executes 'receive'.
  457: 
  458: exit_and_timeout(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  459:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 20}),
  460: 
  461:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  462:     Parent = self(),
  463:     Low = fun_spawn(fun() -> eat_low(Parent) end),
  464:     High = fun_spawn(fun() -> eat_high(Low) end),
  465:     eat_wait_for(Low, High),
  466:     ok.
  467: 
  468: 
  469: eat_wait_for(Low, High) ->
  470:     receive
  471: 	{'EXIT', Low, {you, are, dead}} ->
  472: 	    ok;
  473: 	{'EXIT', High, normal} ->
  474: 	    eat_wait_for(Low, High);
  475: 	Other ->
  476: 	    ct:fail({bad_message, Other})
  477:     end.
  478: 
  479: eat_low(_Parent) ->
  480:     receive
  481:     after 2500 ->
  482: 	    ok
  483:     end,
  484:     receive
  485: 	Any ->
  486: 	    io:format("Received: ~p\n", [Any])
  487:     after 1000 ->
  488: 	    ok
  489:     end.
  490:     
  491: eat_high(Low) ->
  492:     process_flag(priority, high),
  493:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
  494:     exit(Low, {you, are, dead}),
  495:     loop(erlang:monotonic_time() + erlang:convert_time_unit(5,second,native)).
  496: 
  497: %% Busy loop for 5 seconds.
  498: 
  499: loop(StopTime) ->
  500:     case StopTime >= erlang:monotonic_time() of
  501: 	true -> ok;
  502: 	false -> loop(StopTime)
  503:     end.
  504: 
  505: 
  506: %% Tries to send two different exit messages to a process.
  507: %% (The second one should be ignored.)
  508: exit_twice(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  509:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 20}),
  510: 
  511:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  512:     Low = fun_spawn(fun etwice_low/0),
  513:     High = fun_spawn(fun() -> etwice_high(Low) end),
  514:     etwice_wait_for(Low, High),
  515:     ok.
  516: 
  517: etwice_wait_for(Low, High) ->
  518:     receive
  519: 	{'EXIT', Low, first} ->
  520: 	    ok;
  521: 	{'EXIT', Low, Other} ->
  522: 	    ct:fail({wrong_exit_reason, Other});
  523: 	{'EXIT', High, normal} ->
  524: 	    etwice_wait_for(Low, High);
  525: 	Other ->
  526: 	    ct:fail({bad_message, Other})
  527:     end.
  528: 
  529: etwice_low() ->
  530:     etwice_low().
  531: 
  532: etwice_high(Low) ->
  533:     process_flag(priority, high),
  534:     exit(Low, first),
  535:     exit(Low, second).
  536: 
  537: %% Tests the process_info/2 BIF.
  538: t_process_info(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  539:     [] = process_info(self(), registered_name),
  540:     register(my_name, self()),
  541:     {registered_name, my_name} = process_info(self(), registered_name),
  542:     {status, running} = process_info(self(), status),
  543:     {min_heap_size, 233} = process_info(self(), min_heap_size),
  544:     {min_bin_vheap_size,46422} = process_info(self(), min_bin_vheap_size),
  545:     {max_heap_size, #{ size := 0, kill := true, error_logger := true,
  546:                        include_shared_binaries := false}} =
  547:         process_info(self(), max_heap_size),
  548:     {current_function,{?MODULE,t_process_info,1}} =
  549: 	process_info(self(), current_function),
  550:     {current_function,{?MODULE,t_process_info,1}} =
  551: 	apply(erlang, process_info, [self(),current_function]),
  552: 
  553:     %% current_location and current_stacktrace
  554:     {Line1,Res1} = {?LINE,process_info(self(), current_location)},
  555:     verify_loc(Line1, Res1),
  556:     {Line2,Res2} = {?LINE,apply(erlang, process_info,
  557: 				[self(),current_location])},
  558:     verify_loc(Line2, Res2),
  559:     pi_stacktrace([{?MODULE,t_process_info,1,?LINE}]),
  560: 
  561:     verify_stacktrace_depth(),
  562: 
  563:     Gleader = group_leader(),
  564:     {group_leader, Gleader} = process_info(self(), group_leader),
  565:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_Info}} = (catch process_info('not_a_pid')),
  566:     ok.
  567: 
  568: verify_stacktrace_depth() ->
  569:     CS = current_stacktrace,
  570:     OldDepth = erlang:system_flag(backtrace_depth, 0),
  571:     {CS,[]} = erlang:process_info(self(), CS),
  572:     _ = erlang:system_flag(backtrace_depth, 8),
  573:     {CS,[{?MODULE,verify_stacktrace_depth,0,_},_|_]} =
  574:         erlang:process_info(self(), CS),
  575:     _ = erlang:system_flag(backtrace_depth, OldDepth).
  576: 
  577: pi_stacktrace(Expected0) ->
  578:     {Line,Res} = {?LINE,erlang:process_info(self(), current_stacktrace)},
  579:     {current_stacktrace,Stack} = Res,
  580:     Expected = [{?MODULE,pi_stacktrace,1,Line}|Expected0],
  581:     pi_stacktrace_1(Stack, Expected).
  582: 
  583: pi_stacktrace_1([{M,F,A,Loc}|Stk], [{M,F,A,Line}|Exp]) ->
  584:     case Loc of
  585: 	[] ->
  586: 	    %% No location info for some reason (+L, native code).
  587: 	    io:format("Missing location information for ~w:~w/~w",
  588: 		      [M,F,A]),
  589: 	    ok;
  590: 	[_|_] ->
  591: 	    Line = proplists:get_value(line, Loc),
  592: 	    File = proplists:get_value(file, Loc),
  593: 	    File = ?MODULE_STRING ++ ".erl"
  594:     end,
  595:     pi_stacktrace_1(Stk, Exp);
  596: pi_stacktrace_1([_|_], []) -> ok.
  597: 
  598: verify_loc(Line, {current_location,{?MODULE,t_process_info=F,1=A,Loc}}) ->
  599:     case Loc of
  600: 	[] ->
  601: 	    %% No location info for some reason (+L, native code).
  602: 	    io:format("Missing location information for ~w:~w/~w",
  603: 		      [?MODULE,F,A]),
  604: 	    ok;
  605: 	[_|_] ->
  606: 	    Line = proplists:get_value(line, Loc),
  607: 	    File = proplists:get_value(file, Loc),
  608: 	    File = ?MODULE_STRING ++ ".erl"
  609:     end.
  610: 
  611: process_info_other(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  612:     Self = self(),
  613:     Pid = spawn_link(fun() -> process_info_looper(Self) end),
  614:     receive after 1 -> ok end,
  615:     pio_current_location(10000, Pid, 0, 0),
  616:     pio_current_stacktrace().
  617: 
  618: pio_current_location(0, _, Pi, Looper) ->
  619:     io:format("~w call(s) to erlang:process_info/2", [Pi]),
  620:     io:format("~w call(s) to ~w:process_info_looper/1", [Looper,?MODULE]);
  621: pio_current_location(N, Pid, Pi, Looper) ->
  622:     erlang:yield(),
  623:     {current_location,Where} = process_info(Pid, current_location),
  624:     case Where of
  625: 	{erlang,process_info,2,[]} ->
  626: 	    pio_current_location(N-1, Pid, Pi+1, Looper);
  627: 	{erts_internal,await_result,1, Loc} when is_list(Loc) ->
  628: 	    pio_current_location(N-1, Pid, Pi+1, Looper);
  629: 	{?MODULE,process_info_looper,1,Loc} when is_list(Loc) ->
  630: 	    pio_current_location(N-1, Pid, Pi, Looper+1);
  631: 	_ ->
  632: 	    exit({unexpected_location, Where})
  633:     end.
  634: 
  635: pio_current_stacktrace() ->
  636:     L = [begin
  637: 	     case process_info(P, current_stacktrace) of
  638:                  {current_stacktrace, Stk} -> {P,Stk};
  639:                  undefined -> {P, []}
  640:              end
  641: 	 end || P <- processes()],
  642:     [erlang:garbage_collect(P) || {P,_} <- L],
  643:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
  644:     [verify_stacktrace(Stk) || {_,Stk} <- L],
  645:     ok.
  646: 
  647: verify_stacktrace([{M,F,A,Loc}|T])
  648:   when is_atom(M),
  649:        is_atom(F),
  650:        is_integer(A),
  651:        is_list(Loc) ->
  652:     verify_stacktrace(T);
  653: verify_stacktrace([]) -> ok.
  654: 
  655: process_info_looper(Parent) ->
  656:     process_info(Parent, current_location),
  657:     process_info_looper(Parent).
  658: 
  659: %% Tests the process_info/1 BIF on another process with messages.
  660: process_info_other_msg(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  661:     Self = self(),
  662:     Pid = spawn_link(fun() -> other_process(Self) end),
  663:     receive
  664: 	{go_ahead,Pid} -> ok
  665:     end,
  666: 
  667:     Own = {my,own,message},
  668: 
  669:     {messages,[Own]} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  670:     
  671:     Garbage = kb_128(),
  672:     MsgA = {a,Garbage},
  673:     MsgB = {b,Garbage},
  674:     MsgC = {c,Garbage},
  675:     MsgD = {d,Garbage},
  676:     MsgE = {e,Garbage},
  677: 
  678:     Pid ! MsgA,
  679:     {messages,[Own,MsgA]} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  680:     Pid ! MsgB,
  681:     {messages,[Own,MsgA,MsgB]} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  682:     Pid ! MsgC,
  683:     {messages,[Own,MsgA,MsgB,MsgC]} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  684:     Pid ! MsgD,
  685:     {messages,[Own,MsgA,MsgB,MsgC,MsgD]} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  686:     Pid ! MsgE,
  687:     {messages,[Own,MsgA,MsgB,MsgC,MsgD,MsgE]=All} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  688:     {memory,BytesOther} = process_info(Pid, memory),
  689:     {memory,BytesSelf} = process_info(self(), memory),
  690: 
  691:     io:format("Memory ~p: ~p\n", [Pid,BytesOther]),
  692:     io:format("Memory ~p (self): ~p\n", [self(),BytesSelf]),
  693: 
  694:     [Own,MsgA,MsgB,MsgC,MsgD,MsgE] = All,
  695: 
  696:     Pid ! {self(),empty},
  697:     receive
  698: 	      empty -> ok
  699: 	  end,
  700:     {messages,[]} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  701: 
  702:     {min_heap_size, 233} = process_info(Pid, min_heap_size),
  703:     {min_bin_vheap_size, 46422} = process_info(Pid, min_bin_vheap_size),
  704:     {max_heap_size, #{ size := 0, kill := true, error_logger := true,
  705:                        include_shared_binaries := false}} =
  706:         process_info(Pid, max_heap_size),
  707: 
  708:     Pid ! stop,
  709:     ok.
  710: 
  711: process_info_other_message_queue_len_signal_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  712:     %% OTP-18169
  713:     %%
  714:     %% The race window triggering this bug is quite small. This test
  715:     %% wont fail even with the bug present, but it may trigger an
  716:     %% assertion in the debug compiled emulator if the bug is
  717:     %% present...
  718:     process_flag(priority, high),
  719:     SSchdlr = case erlang:system_info(schedulers_online) of
  720:                   1 -> 1;
  721:                   _ -> 2
  722:               end,
  723:     Flush = fun Flush () ->
  724:                     receive _ -> Flush()
  725:                     after 0 -> ok
  726:                     end
  727:             end,
  728:     RFun = fun RFun () ->
  729:                    receive
  730:                        {flush, From} ->
  731:                            Flush(),
  732:                            From ! flushed
  733:                    end,
  734:                    RFun()
  735:            end,
  736:     R = spawn_opt(RFun, [link,
  737:                          {scheduler, 1},
  738:                          {message_queue_data, on_heap}]),
  739:     SFun = fun SFun () ->
  740:                    receive go -> ok end,
  741:                    M = erlang:monitor(process, R),
  742:                    R ! hi,
  743:                    receive
  744:                        {demonitor, From} ->
  745:                            _ = erlang:demonitor(M),
  746:                            From ! demonitored
  747:                    end,
  748:                    SFun()
  749:            end,
  750:     S = spawn_opt(SFun, [link,
  751:                          {scheduler, SSchdlr},
  752:                          {priority, high}]),
  753:     process_info_other_message_queue_len_signal_race_test(10000, S, R),
  754:     unlink(R),
  755:     exit(R, kill),
  756:     unlink(S),
  757:     exit(S, kill),
  758:     false = is_process_alive(R),
  759:     false = is_process_alive(S),
  760:     ok.
  761: 
  762: process_info_other_message_queue_len_signal_race_test(0, _S, _R) ->
  763:     ok;
  764: process_info_other_message_queue_len_signal_race_test(N, S, R) ->
  765:     S ! go,
  766:     erlang:yield(),
  767:     _ = process_info(R, message_queue_len),
  768:     S ! {demonitor, self()},
  769:     receive demonitored -> ok end,
  770:     R ! {flush, self()},
  771:     receive flushed -> ok end,
  772:     process_info_other_message_queue_len_signal_race_test(N-1, S, R).
  773: 
  774: process_info_other_dist_msg(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  775:     %%
  776:     %% Check that process_info can handle messages that have not been
  777:     %% decoded yet.
  778:     %%
  779:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  780:     Self = self(),
  781:     Pid = spawn_link(fun() -> other_process(Self) end),
  782:     receive {go_ahead,Pid} -> ok end,
  783: 
  784:     Own = {my,own,message},
  785: 
  786:     {messages,[Own]} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  787:     Garbage = kb_128(),
  788:     MsgA = {a,self(),Garbage},
  789:     MsgB = {b,self(),Garbage},
  790:     MsgC = {c,self(),Garbage},
  791:     MsgD = {d,self(),Garbage},
  792:     MsgE = {e,self(),Garbage},
  793: 
  794:     %% We don't want the other process to decode messages itself
  795:     %% therefore we suspend it.
  796:     true =  erlang:suspend_process(Pid),
  797:     spawn_link(Node, fun () ->
  798: 		Pid  ! MsgA,
  799: 		Pid  ! MsgB,
  800: 		Pid  ! MsgC,
  801: 		Self ! check_abc
  802: 	end),
  803:     receive check_abc -> ok end,
  804:     [{status,suspended},
  805: 	{messages,[Own,MsgA,MsgB,MsgC]},
  806: 	{status,suspended}]= process_info(Pid, [status,messages,status]),
  807:     spawn_link(Node, fun () ->
  808: 		Pid  ! MsgD,
  809: 		Pid  ! MsgE,
  810: 		Self ! check_de
  811: 	end),
  812:     receive check_de -> ok end,
  813:     {messages,[Own,MsgA,MsgB,MsgC,MsgD,MsgE]=All} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  814:     true = erlang:resume_process(Pid),
  815:     Pid ! {self(), get_all_messages},
  816:     receive
  817: 	      {all_messages, AllMsgs} ->
  818: 		  All = AllMsgs
  819: 	  end,
  820:     {messages,[]} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  821:     Pid ! stop,
  822:     stop_node(Peer, Node),
  823:     ok.
  824: 
  825: process_info_other_status(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  826:     %% OTP-17628: status was erroneously reported as 'running',
  827:     %% when it should be 'waiting', when the priority of the
  828:     %% caller exceeded the priority of the processes being
  829:     %% checked (due to prio elevation).
  830:     Self = self(),
  831:     Other = spawn_link(fun () -> other_process(Self) end),
  832:     receive {go_ahead, Other} -> ok end,
  833:     receive after 100 -> ok end,
  834:     {status, waiting} = process_info(Other, status),
  835:     process_flag(priority, high),
  836:     {status, waiting} = process_info(Other, status),
  837:     process_flag(priority, max),
  838:     {status, waiting} = process_info(Other, status),
  839:     Other ! stop,
  840:     ok.
  841: 
  842: other_process(Parent) ->
  843:     self() ! {my,own,message},
  844:     Parent ! {go_ahead,self()},
  845:     other_process_1().
  846: 
  847: other_process_1() ->
  848:     receive
  849: 	{Parent,get_all_messages} ->
  850: 	    Parent ! {all_messages, get_all_messages()},
  851: 	    other_process_1();
  852: 	{Parent,empty} ->
  853: 	    receive_all(),
  854: 	    Parent ! empty,
  855: 	    other_process_1();
  856: 	stop -> ok
  857:     end.
  858: 
  859: get_all_messages() ->
  860:     get_all_messages([]).
  861: 
  862: get_all_messages(Msgs) ->
  863:     receive
  864: 	Msg ->
  865: 	    get_all_messages([Msg|Msgs])
  866:     after 0 ->
  867: 	    lists:reverse(Msgs)
  868:     end.
  869: 
  870: receive_all() ->
  871:     receive
  872: 	_ -> receive_all()
  873:     after 0 -> ok
  874:     end.
  875: 
  876: chk_pi_order([],[]) ->
  877:     ok;
  878: chk_pi_order([{Arg, _}| Values], [Arg|Args]) ->
  879:     chk_pi_order(Values, Args).
  880: 
  881: process_info_2_list(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  882:     Proc = spawn_link(fun () -> receive after infinity -> ok end end),
  883:     register(process_SUITE_process_info_2_list1, self()),
  884:     register(process_SUITE_process_info_2_list2, Proc),
  885:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state,true),
  886:     AllArgs = erts_debug:get_internal_state(process_info_args),
  887:     A1 = lists:sort(AllArgs) ++ [status] ++ lists:reverse(AllArgs),
  888: 
  889:     %% Verify that argument is accepted as single atom
  890:     lists:foreach(fun (A) ->
  891: 		{A, _} = process_info(Proc, A),
  892: 		{A, _} = process_info(self(), A)
  893: 	end, A1),
  894: 
  895:     %% Verify that order is preserved
  896:     ok = chk_pi_order(process_info(self(), A1), A1),
  897:     ok = chk_pi_order(process_info(Proc, A1), A1),
  898: 
  899:     %% Small arg list
  900:     A2 = [status, stack_size, trap_exit, priority],
  901:     [{status, _}, {stack_size, _}, {trap_exit, _}, {priority, _}]
  902: 	= process_info(Proc, A2),
  903:     [{status, _}, {stack_size, _}, {trap_exit, _}, {priority, _}]
  904: 	= process_info(self(), A2),
  905: 
  906:     %% Huge arg list (note values are shared)
  907:     A3 = lists:duplicate(5000,backtrace),
  908:     V3 = process_info(Proc, A3),
  909:     5000 = length(V3),
  910:     lists:foreach(fun ({backtrace, _}) -> ok end, V3),
  911:     ok.
  912:     
  913: process_info_lock_reschedule(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  914:     %% We need a process that is running and an item that requires
  915:     %% process_info to take the main process lock.
  916:     Target1 = spawn_link(fun tok_loop/0),
  917:     Name1 = process_info_lock_reschedule_running,
  918:     register(Name1, Target1),
  919:     Target2 = spawn_link(fun () -> receive after infinity -> ok end end),
  920:     Name2 = process_info_lock_reschedule_waiting,
  921:     register(Name2, Target2),
  922:     PI = fun(_) ->
  923: 	    erlang:yield(),
  924: 	    [{registered_name, Name1}] = process_info(Target1, [registered_name]),
  925: 	    [{registered_name, Name2}] = process_info(Target2, [registered_name]),
  926: 	    erlang:yield(),
  927: 	    {registered_name, Name1} = process_info(Target1, registered_name),
  928: 	    {registered_name, Name2} = process_info(Target2, registered_name),
  929: 	    erlang:yield(),
  930: 	    [{registered_name, Name1}| _] = process_info(Target1),
  931: 	    [{registered_name, Name2}| _] = process_info(Target2)
  932:     end,
  933:     lists:foreach(PI, lists:seq(1,1000)),
  934:     %% Make sure Target1 still is willing to "tok loop"
  935:     case process_info(Target1, status) of
  936: 	{status, OkStatus} when OkStatus == runnable;
  937: 				OkStatus == running;
  938: 				OkStatus == garbage_collecting ->
  939: 	    unlink(Target1),
  940: 	    unlink(Target2),
  941: 	    exit(Target1, bang),
  942: 	    exit(Target2, bang),
  943: 	    OkStatus;
  944: 	{status, BadStatus} ->
  945: 	    ct:fail(BadStatus)
  946:     end.
  947: 
  948: pi_loop(_Name, _Pid, 0) ->
  949:     ok;
  950: pi_loop(Name, Pid, N) ->
  951:     {registered_name, Name} = process_info(Pid, registered_name),
  952:     pi_loop(Name, Pid, N-1).
  953: 
  954: process_info_lock_reschedule2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  955:     Parent = self(),
  956:     Fun = fun () ->
  957: 	    receive {go, Name, Pid} -> ok end,
  958: 	    pi_loop(Name, Pid, 10000),
  959: 	    Parent ! {done, self()},
  960: 	    receive after infinity -> ok end
  961:     end,
  962:     P1 = spawn_link(Fun),
  963:     N1 = process_info_lock_reschedule2_1,
  964:     true = register(N1, P1),
  965:     P2 = spawn_link(Fun),
  966:     N2 = process_info_lock_reschedule2_2,
  967:     true = register(N2, P2),
  968:     P3 = spawn_link(Fun),
  969:     N3 = process_info_lock_reschedule2_3,
  970:     true = register(N3, P3),
  971:     P4 = spawn_link(Fun),
  972:     N4 = process_info_lock_reschedule2_4,
  973:     true = register(N4, P4),
  974:     P5 = spawn_link(Fun),
  975:     N5 = process_info_lock_reschedule2_5,
  976:     true = register(N5, P5),
  977:     P6 = spawn_link(Fun),
  978:     N6 = process_info_lock_reschedule2_6,
  979:     true = register(N6, P6),
  980:     P1 ! {go, N2, P2},
  981:     P2 ! {go, N1, P1},
  982:     P3 ! {go, N1, P1},
  983:     P4 ! {go, N1, P1},
  984:     P5 ! {go, N6, P6},
  985:     P6 ! {go, N5, P5},
  986:     receive {done, P1} -> ok end,
  987:     receive {done, P2} -> ok end,
  988:     receive {done, P3} -> ok end,
  989:     receive {done, P4} -> ok end,
  990:     receive {done, P5} -> ok end,
  991:     receive {done, P6} -> ok end,
  992:     unlink(P1), exit(P1, bang),
  993:     unlink(P2), exit(P2, bang),
  994:     unlink(P3), exit(P3, bang),
  995:     unlink(P4), exit(P4, bang),
  996:     unlink(P5), exit(P5, bang),
  997:     unlink(P6), exit(P6, bang),
  998:     ok.
  999: 
 1000: many_args(0,_B,_C,_D,_E,_F,_G,_H,_I,_J) ->
 1001:     ok;
 1002: many_args(A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H,I,J) ->
 1003:     many_args(A-1,B,C,D,E,F,G,H,I,J).
 1004: 
 1005: do_pi_msg_len(PT, AT) ->
 1006:     lists:map(fun (_) -> ok end, [a,b,c,d]),
 1007:     {message_queue_len, _} = process_info(element(2,PT), element(2,AT)).
 1008:     
 1009: process_info_lock_reschedule3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1010:     %% We need a process that is running and an item that requires
 1011:     %% process_info to take the main process lock.
 1012:     Target1 = spawn_link(fun tok_loop/0),
 1013:     Name1 = process_info_lock_reschedule_running,
 1014:     register(Name1, Target1),
 1015:     Target2 = spawn_link(fun () -> receive after infinity -> ok end end),
 1016:     Name2 = process_info_lock_reschedule_waiting,
 1017:     register(Name2, Target2),
 1018:     PI = fun(N) ->
 1019: 	    case N rem 10 of
 1020: 		0 -> erlang:yield();
 1021: 		_ -> ok
 1022: 	    end,
 1023: 	    do_pi_msg_len({proc, Target1},
 1024: 		{arg, message_queue_len})
 1025:     end,
 1026:     many_args(100000,1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9),
 1027:     lists:foreach(PI, lists:seq(1,1000000)),
 1028:     %% Make sure Target1 still is willing to "tok loop"
 1029:     case process_info(Target1, status) of
 1030: 	      {status, OkStatus} when OkStatus == runnable;
 1031: 				      OkStatus == running;
 1032: 				      OkStatus == garbage_collecting ->
 1033: 		  unlink(Target1),
 1034: 		  unlink(Target2),
 1035: 		  exit(Target1, bang),
 1036: 		  exit(Target2, bang),
 1037: 		  OkStatus;
 1038: 	      {status, BadStatus} ->
 1039: 		  ct:fail(BadStatus)
 1040: 	  end.
 1041: 
 1042: otp_4725(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1043:     Tester = self(),
 1044:     Ref1 = make_ref(),
 1045:     Pid1 = spawn_opt(fun () ->
 1046: 		Tester ! {Ref1, process_info(self())},
 1047: 		receive
 1048: 		    Ref1 -> bye
 1049: 		end
 1050: 	end, [link, {priority, max}, {fullsweep_after, 600}]),
 1051:     receive
 1052: 	{Ref1, ProcInfo1A} ->
 1053: 	    ProcInfo1B = process_info(Pid1),
 1054: 	    Pid1 ! Ref1,
 1055: 	    check_proc_infos(ProcInfo1A, ProcInfo1B)
 1056:     end,
 1057:     Ref2 = make_ref(),
 1058:     Pid2 = spawn_opt(fun () ->
 1059: 		Tester ! {Ref2, process_info(self())},
 1060: 		receive
 1061: 		    Ref2 -> bye
 1062: 		end
 1063: 	end,
 1064: 	[]),
 1065:     receive
 1066: 	{Ref2, ProcInfo2A} ->
 1067: 	    ProcInfo2B = process_info(Pid2),
 1068: 	    Pid2 ! Ref2,
 1069: 	    check_proc_infos(ProcInfo2A, ProcInfo2B)
 1070:     end,
 1071:     ok.
 1072: 
 1073: check_proc_infos(A, B) ->
 1074:     IC = lists:keysearch(initial_call, 1, A),
 1075:     IC = lists:keysearch(initial_call, 1, B),
 1076: 
 1077:     L = lists:keysearch(links, 1, A),
 1078:     L = lists:keysearch(links, 1, B),
 1079: 
 1080:     D = lists:keysearch(dictionary, 1, A),
 1081:     D = lists:keysearch(dictionary, 1, B),
 1082: 
 1083:     TE = lists:keysearch(trap_exit, 1, A),
 1084:     TE = lists:keysearch(trap_exit, 1, B),
 1085: 
 1086:     EH = lists:keysearch(error_handler, 1, A),
 1087:     EH = lists:keysearch(error_handler, 1, B),
 1088: 
 1089:     P = lists:keysearch(priority, 1, A),
 1090:     P = lists:keysearch(priority, 1, B),
 1091: 
 1092:     GL = lists:keysearch(group_leader, 1, A),
 1093:     GL = lists:keysearch(group_leader, 1, B),
 1094: 
 1095:     GC = lists:keysearch(garbage_collection, 1, A),
 1096:     GC = lists:keysearch(garbage_collection, 1, B),
 1097:     {value, {garbage_collection, GClist}} = GC,
 1098: 
 1099:     %% This is not really documented
 1100:     true = is_integer(gv(minor_gcs, GClist)),
 1101:     true = is_integer(gv(fullsweep_after, GClist)),
 1102:     true = is_integer(gv(min_heap_size, GClist)),
 1103:     #{error_logger := Bool1,
 1104:       include_shared_binaries := Bool2,
 1105:       kill := Bool3,
 1106:       size := MaxHeapSize} = gv(max_heap_size, GClist),
 1107:     true = is_boolean(Bool1),
 1108:     true = is_boolean(Bool2),
 1109:     true = is_boolean(Bool3),
 1110:     true = is_integer(MaxHeapSize),
 1111: 
 1112:     ok.
 1113:
