 1116: 
 1117: start_spawner() ->
 1118:     ok.
 1119: 
 1120: stop_spawner() ->
 1121:     ok.
 1122: 
 1123: %% Tests erlang:process_info(Pid, garbage_collection_info)
 1124: process_info_garbage_collection(_Config) ->
 1125:     Parent = self(),
 1126:     Pid = spawn_link(
 1127:             fun() ->
 1128:                     %% We set mqd to off_heap and send an tuple
 1129:                     %% to process in order to force mbuf_size
 1130:                     %% to be used
 1131:                     process_flag(message_queue_data, off_heap),
 1132:                     receive go -> ok end,
 1133:                     (fun F(0) ->
 1134:                              Parent ! deep,
 1135:                              receive {ok,_} -> ok end,
 1136:                              [];
 1137:                          F(N) ->
 1138:                              timer:sleep(1),
 1139:                              [lists:seq(1,100) | F(N-1)]
 1140:                      end)(1000),
 1141:                     Parent ! shallow,
 1142:                     receive done -> ok end
 1143:             end),
 1144:     [{garbage_collection_info, Before},{total_heap_size, THSBefore}] =
 1145:         erlang:process_info(Pid, [garbage_collection_info, total_heap_size]),
 1146:     Pid ! go, receive deep -> ok end,
 1147:     [{_, Deep},{_,THSDeep}]  =
 1148:          erlang:process_info(Pid, [garbage_collection_info, total_heap_size]),
 1149:     Pid ! {ok, make_ref()}, receive shallow -> ok end,
 1150:     [{_, After},{_, THSAfter}] =
 1151:         erlang:process_info(Pid, [garbage_collection_info, total_heap_size]),
 1152:     Pid ! done,
 1153: 
 1154:     %% Do some general checks to see if everything seems to be roughly correct
 1155:     ct:log("Before: ~p",[Before]),
 1156:     ct:log("Deep: ~p",[Deep]),
 1157:     ct:log("After: ~p",[After]),
 1158:     ct:log("Before THS: ~p",[THSBefore]),
 1159:     ct:log("Deep THS: ~p",[THSDeep]),
 1160:     ct:log("After THS: ~p",[THSAfter]),
 1161: 
 1162:     %% Check stack_size
 1163:     true = gv(stack_size, Before) < gv(stack_size, Deep),
 1164:     true = gv(stack_size, After) < gv(stack_size, Deep),
 1165: 
 1166:     %% Check used heap size
 1167:     true = gv(heap_size, Before) + gv(old_heap_size, Before)
 1168:         < gv(heap_size, Deep) + gv(old_heap_size, Deep),
 1169:     true = gv(heap_size, Before) + gv(old_heap_size, Before)
 1170:         < gv(heap_size, After) + gv(old_heap_size, After),
 1171: 
 1172:     %% Check that total_heap_size == heap_block_size + old_heap_block_size + mbuf_size
 1173:     THSBefore = gv(heap_block_size, Before)
 1174:         + gv(old_heap_block_size, Before)
 1175:         + gv(mbuf_size, Before),
 1176: 
 1177:     THSDeep = gv(heap_block_size, Deep)
 1178:         + gv(old_heap_block_size, Deep)
 1179:         + gv(mbuf_size, Deep),
 1180: 
 1181:     THSAfter = gv(heap_block_size, After)
 1182:         + gv(old_heap_block_size, After)
 1183:         + gv(mbuf_size, After),
 1184: 
 1185:     ok.
 1186: 
 1187: gv(Key,List) ->
 1188:     proplists:get_value(Key,List).
 1189: 
 1190: process_info_parent(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1191:     Child = spawn_link(fun () -> receive stop -> ok end end),
 1192:     ?assertEqual({parent, self()}, erlang:process_info(Child, parent)),
 1193:     Child ! stop,
 1194:     ?assertEqual({parent, undefined}, erlang:process_info(whereis(init), parent)),
 1195: 
 1196:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1197:     RemoteChild = spawn_link(Node,
 1198:                              fun () ->
 1199:                                      {parent, Parent} = process_info(self(), parent),
 1200:                                      garbage_collect(),
 1201:                                      {parent, Parent} = process_info(self(), parent),
 1202:                                      garbage_collect(),
 1203:                                      Parent ! remote_child_hello,
 1204:                                      receive stop -> ok end
 1205:                              end),
 1206:     ?assertEqual({parent, self()},
 1207:                  erpc:call(Node, erlang, process_info, [RemoteChild, parent])),
 1208:     receive remote_child_hello -> ok end,
 1209:     unlink(RemoteChild),
 1210:     RemoteChild ! stop,
 1211:     peer:stop(Peer),
 1212:     ok.
 1213: 
 1214: process_info_smoke_all_tester() ->
 1215:     register(process_info_smoke_all_tester, self()),
 1216:     put(ets_ref, ets:new(blupp, [])),
 1217:     put(binary, [list_to_binary(lists:duplicate(1000, 1)),
 1218:                  list_to_binary(lists:duplicate(1000, 2))]),
 1219:     process_info_smoke_all_tester_loop().
 1220: 
 1221: process_info_smoke_all_tester_loop() ->
 1222:     receive
 1223:         {other_process, Pid} ->
 1224:             case get(procs) of
 1225:                 undefined -> put(procs, [Pid]);
 1226:                 Procs -> put(procs, [Pid|Procs])
 1227:             end,
 1228:             erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 1229:             link(Pid),
 1230:             process_info_smoke_all_tester_loop()
 1231:     end.
 1232: 
 1233: process_info_smoke_all(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1234:     AllPIOptions = [registered_name,
 1235:                     current_function,
 1236:                     initial_call,
 1237:                     messages,
 1238:                     message_queue_len,
 1239:                     links,
 1240:                     monitors,
 1241:                     monitored_by,
 1242:                     dictionary,
 1243:                     trap_exit,
 1244:                     error_handler,
 1245:                     heap_size,
 1246:                     stack_size,
 1247:                     memory,
 1248:                     garbage_collection,
 1249:                     group_leader,
 1250:                     reductions,
 1251:                     priority,
 1252:                     trace,
 1253:                     binary,
 1254:                     sequential_trace_token,
 1255:                     catchlevel,
 1256:                     backtrace,
 1257:                     last_calls,
 1258:                     total_heap_size,
 1259:                     suspending,
 1260:                     min_heap_size,
 1261:                     min_bin_vheap_size,
 1262:                     max_heap_size,
 1263:                     current_location,
 1264:                     current_stacktrace,
 1265:                     message_queue_data,
 1266:                     garbage_collection_info,
 1267:                     magic_ref,
 1268:                     fullsweep_after,
 1269:                     {dictionary, ets_ref}],
 1270: 
 1271:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1272:     RP = spawn_link(Node, fun process_info_smoke_all_tester/0),
 1273:     LP = spawn_link(fun process_info_smoke_all_tester/0),
 1274:     RP ! {other_process, LP},
 1275:     LP ! {other_process, RP},
 1276:     LP ! {other_process, self()},
 1277:     LP ! ets:new(blapp, []),
 1278:     LP ! ets:new(blipp, []),
 1279:     LP ! list_to_binary(lists:duplicate(1000, 3)),
 1280:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
 1281:     _MLP = erlang:monitor(process, LP),
 1282:     true = is_process_alive(LP),
 1283:     PI = process_info(LP, AllPIOptions),
 1284:     io:format("~p~n", [PI]),
 1285:     garbage_collect(),
 1286:     unlink(RP),
 1287:     unlink(LP),
 1288:     exit(RP, kill),
 1289:     exit(LP, kill),
 1290:     false = is_process_alive(LP),
 1291:     stop_node(Peer, Node),
 1292:     ok.
 1293: 
 1294: process_info_status_handled_signal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1295:     P = spawn_link(fun () ->
 1296:                            receive after infinity -> ok end
 1297:                    end),
 1298:     wait_until(fun () ->
 1299:                        process_info(P, status) == {status, waiting}
 1300:                end),
 1301:     %%
 1302:     %% The 'messages' option will force a process-info-request
 1303:     %% signal to be scheduled on the process. Ensure that status
 1304:     %% 'waiting' is reported even though it is actually running
 1305:     %% when handling the request. We want it to report the status
 1306:     %% it would have had if it had not been handling the
 1307:     %% process-info-request...
 1308:     %%
 1309:     [{status, waiting}, {messages, []}] = process_info(P, [status, messages]),
 1310:     unlink(P),
 1311:     exit(P, kill),
 1312:     false = erlang:is_process_alive(P),
 1313:     ok.
 1314: 
 1315: %% OTP-15709
 1316: %% Provoke a bug where process_info(reductions) returned wrong result
 1317: %% because REDS_IN (def_arg_reg[5]) is read when the process in not running.
 1318: %%
 1319: %% And a bug where process_info(reductions) on a process which was releasing its
 1320: %% main lock during execution could result in negative reduction diffs.
 1321: process_info_reductions(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1322:     {S1, S2} = case erlang:system_info(schedulers_online) of
 1323:                    1 -> {1,1};
 1324:                    _ -> {1,2}
 1325:                end,
 1326:     io:format("Run on schedulers ~p and ~p\n", [S1,S2]),
 1327:     Boss = self(),
 1328:     Doer = spawn_opt(fun () ->
 1329:                              pi_reductions_tester(true, 10, fun pi_reductions_spinnloop/0, S2),
 1330:                              pi_reductions_tester(true, 10, fun pi_reductions_recvloop/0, S2),
 1331:                              pi_reductions_tester(false, 100, fun pi_reductions_main_unlocker/0, S2),
 1332:                              Boss ! {self(), done}
 1333:                      end,
 1334:                      [link, {scheduler, S1}]),
 1335: 
 1336:     {Doer, done} = receive M -> M end,
 1337:     ok.
 1338: 
 1339: pi_reductions_tester(ForceSignal, MaxCalls, Fun, S2) ->
 1340:     Pid = spawn_opt(Fun, [link, {scheduler,S2}]),
 1341:     Extra = case ForceSignal of
 1342:                 true ->
 1343:                     %% Add another item that force sending the request
 1344:                     %% as a signal, like 'current_function'.
 1345:                     [current_function];
 1346:                 false ->
 1347:                     []
 1348:             end,
 1349:     LoopFun = fun Me(Calls, Prev, Acc0) ->
 1350:                       PI = process_info(Pid, [reductions | Extra]),
 1351:                       [{reductions,Reds} | _] = PI,
 1352:                       Diff = Reds - Prev,
 1353:                       %% Verify we get sane non-negative reduction diffs
 1354:                       {Diff, true} = {Diff, (Diff >= 0)},
 1355:                       {Diff, true} = {Diff, (Diff =< 1000*1000)},
 1356:                       Acc1 = [Diff | Acc0],
 1357:                       case Calls >= MaxCalls of
 1358:                           true -> Acc1;
 1359:                           false -> Me(Calls+1, Reds, Acc1)
 1360:                       end
 1361:               end,
 1362:     DiffList = LoopFun(0, 0, []),
 1363:     unlink(Pid),
 1364:     exit(Pid,kill),
 1365:     io:format("Reduction diffs: ~p\n", [lists:reverse(DiffList)]),
 1366:     ok.
 1367: 
 1368: pi_reductions_spinnloop() ->
 1369:     %% 6 args to make use of def_arg_reg[5] which is also used as REDS_IN
 1370:     pi_reductions_spinnloop(999*1000, atom, "hej", self(), make_ref(), 3.14).
 1371: 
 1372: pi_reductions_spinnloop(N,A,B,C,D,E) when N > 0 ->
 1373:     pi_reductions_spinnloop(N-1,B,C,D,E,A);
 1374: pi_reductions_spinnloop(0,_,_,_,_,_) ->
 1375:     %% Stop to limit max number of reductions consumed
 1376:     pi_reductions_recvloop().
 1377: 
 1378: pi_reductions_recvloop() ->
 1379:     receive
 1380:         "a free lunch" -> false
 1381:     end.
 1382: 
 1383: pi_reductions_main_unlocker() ->
 1384:     Other = spawn_link(fun() -> receive die -> ok end end),
 1385:     pi_reductions_main_unlocker_loop(Other).
 1386: 
 1387: pi_reductions_main_unlocker_loop(Other) ->
 1388:     %% Assumption: register(OtherPid, Name) will unlock main lock of calling
 1389:     %% process during execution.
 1390:     register(pi_reductions_main_unlocker, Other),
 1391:     unregister(pi_reductions_main_unlocker),
 1392: 
 1393:     %% Yield in order to increase probability of process_info sometimes probing
 1394:     %% this process when it's not RUNNING.
 1395:     erlang:yield(),
 1396:     pi_reductions_main_unlocker_loop(Other).
 1397: 
 1398: process_info_self_signal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1399:     %% Test that signals that we have sent to ourselves are
 1400:     %% visible in process_info() result. This is not strictly
 1401:     %% a necessary property, but implemented so now. See
 1402:     %% process_info.c:process_info_bif() for more info.
 1403:     Self = self(),
 1404:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1405:     pi_sig_spam_test(fun () ->
 1406:                              process_info_self_signal_spammer(Self)
 1407:                      end,
 1408:                      fun () ->
 1409:                              self() ! Ref,
 1410:                              process_info(self(), messages)
 1411:                      end,
 1412:                      fun (Res) ->
 1413:                              {messages, [Ref]} = Res
 1414:                      end).
 1415: 
 1416: process_info_self_signal_spammer(To) ->
 1417:     erlang:demonitor(erlang:monitor(process, To)),
 1418:     process_info_self_signal_spammer(To).
 1419: 
 1420: process_info_self_msgq_len(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1421:     %% Spam ourselves with signals forcing us to flush own
 1422:     %% signal queue..
 1423:     Self = self(),
 1424:     pi_sig_spam_test(fun () ->
 1425:                              process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(Self)
 1426:                      end,
 1427:                      fun () ->
 1428:                              process_info(self(), message_queue_len)
 1429:                      end,
 1430:                      fun (Res) ->
 1431:                              {message_queue_len, Len} = Res,
 1432:                              true = Len > 0,
 1433:                              ok
 1434:                      end).
 1435: 
 1436: 
 1437: process_info_self_msgq_len_messages(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1438:     %% Spam ourselves with signals normally forcing us to flush own
 1439:     %% signal queue, but since we also want messages wont be flushed...
 1440:     Self = self(),
 1441:     pi_sig_spam_test(fun () ->
 1442:                              process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(Self, 100000)
 1443:                      end,
 1444:                      fun () ->
 1445:                              process_info(self(),
 1446:                                           [message_queue_len,
 1447:                                            messages])
 1448:                      end,
 1449:                      fun (Res) ->
 1450:                              [{message_queue_len, Len},
 1451:                               {messages, Msgs}] = Res,
 1452:                              Len = length(Msgs),
 1453:                              ok
 1454:                      end).
 1455: 
 1456: process_info_self_msgq_len_more(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1457:     self() ! hej,
 1458:     BodyRes = process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body(),
 1459:     ok = process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body_result(BodyRes),
 1460:     TailRes = process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail(),
 1461:     ok = process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail_result(TailRes),
 1462:     receive hej -> ok end,
 1463:     %% Check that current_function, current_location, and
 1464:     %% current_stacktrace give sane results flushing or not...
 1465:     Self = self(),
 1466:     pi_sig_spam_test(fun () ->
 1467:                              process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(Self)
 1468:                      end,
 1469:                      fun process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body/0,
 1470:                      fun process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body_result/1),
 1471:     pi_sig_spam_test(fun () ->
 1472:                              process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(Self)
 1473:                      end,
 1474:                      fun process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail/0,
 1475:                      fun process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail_result/1).
 1476: 
 1477: process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body() ->
 1478:     Res = process_info(self(),
 1479:                        [message_queue_len,
 1480:                         current_function,
 1481:                         current_location,
 1482:                         current_stacktrace]),
 1483:     id(Res).
 1484: 
 1485: process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body_result(Res) ->
 1486:     [{message_queue_len, Len},
 1487:      {current_function, {process_SUITE,process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body,0}},
 1488:      {current_location, {process_SUITE,process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body,0,_}},
 1489:      {current_stacktrace,
 1490:       [{process_SUITE,process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body,0,_} | _]}] = Res,
 1491:     true = Len > 0,
 1492:     ok.
 1493: 
 1494: process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail() ->
 1495:     process_info(self(),
 1496:                  [message_queue_len,
 1497:                   current_function,
 1498:                   current_location,
 1499:                   current_stacktrace]).
 1500: 
 1501: process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail_result(Res) ->
 1502:     [{message_queue_len, Len},
 1503:      {current_function, {process_SUITE,process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail,0}},
 1504:      {current_location, {process_SUITE,process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail,0,_}},
 1505:      {current_stacktrace,
 1506:       [{process_SUITE,process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail,0,_} | _]}] = Res,
 1507:     true = Len > 0,
 1508:     ok.
 1509:     
 1510: 
 1511: process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(To) ->
 1512:     process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(To, 10000000).
 1513: 
 1514: process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(_To, 0) ->
 1515:     ok;
 1516: process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(To, N) ->
 1517:     To ! hejhopp,
 1518:     erlang:demonitor(erlang:monitor(process, To)),
 1519:     process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(To, N-1).
 1520: 
 1521: pi_sig_spam_test(SpamFun, PITest, PICheckRes) ->
 1522:     SO = erlang:system_flag(schedulers_online, 1),
 1523:     try
 1524:         Self = self(),
 1525:         SigSpammer = spawn_link(SpamFun),
 1526:         process_flag(priority, low),
 1527:         receive after 10 -> ok end,
 1528:         Res = PITest(),
 1529:         process_flag(priority, high),
 1530:         unlink(SigSpammer),
 1531:         exit(SigSpammer, kill),
 1532:         false = is_process_alive(SigSpammer),
 1533:         PICheckRes(Res)
 1534:     after
 1535:         _ = erlang:system_flag(schedulers_online, SO)
 1536:     end.
 1537: 
 1538: process_info_msgq_len_no_very_long_delay(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1539:     Tester = self(),
 1540:     P1 = spawn_link(fun () ->
 1541:                             receive after infinity -> ok end
 1542:                     end),
 1543:     {message_queue_len, 0} = process_info(self(), message_queue_len),
 1544:     {message_queue_len, 0} = process_info(P1, message_queue_len),
 1545:     P2 = spawn_link(fun () ->
 1546:                             Tester ! hello,
 1547:                             P1 ! hello,
 1548:                             receive after infinity -> ok end
 1549:                     end),
 1550:     receive after 100 -> ok end,
 1551:     {message_queue_len, 1} = process_info(self(), message_queue_len),
 1552:     {message_queue_len, 1} = process_info(P1, message_queue_len),
 1553:     receive hello -> ok end,
 1554:     {message_queue_len, 0} = process_info(self(), message_queue_len),
 1555:     unlink(P1),
 1556:     exit(P1, kill),
 1557:     unlink(P2),
 1558:     exit(P2, kill),
 1559:     false = is_process_alive(P1),
 1560:     false = is_process_alive(P2),
 1561:     ok.
 1562: 
 1563: process_info_dict_lookup(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1564:     Pid = spawn_link(fun proc_dict_helper/0),
 1565:     {async_dist, AsyncDist} = process_info(Pid, async_dist),
 1566:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1567:     Bin = <<17:4096>>,
 1568:     Int0 = 9999999999999999999999999999999999,
 1569:     Int1 = 1111111111111111111111111111111111,
 1570:     Tuple = {make_ref(), erlang:monotonic_time()},
 1571: 
 1572:     %% Check that we can lookup dictionary values on another process...
 1573:     pdh(Pid, put_async, [hej, hopp]),
 1574:     pdh(Pid, put_async, [hopp, hej]),
 1575:     pdh(Pid, put_async, [Ref, Int0]),
 1576:     pdh(Pid, put_async, [Int0, Int1]),
 1577:     pdh(Pid, put_async, [Pid, Ref]),
 1578:     pdh(Pid, put_async, [Tuple, Bin]),
 1579:     undefined = pdh(Pid, put, [Bin, Ref]),
 1580: 
 1581:     erlang:garbage_collect(Pid),
 1582: 
 1583:     {{dictionary, Ref}, Int0} = process_info(Pid, {dictionary, Ref}),
 1584:     [{{dictionary, Ref}, Int0}] = process_info(Pid, [{dictionary, Ref}]),
 1585: 
 1586:     PIRes = process_info(Pid, [async_dist,
 1587:                                trap_exit,
 1588:                                {dictionary, hej},
 1589:                                {dictionary, hopp},
 1590:                                {dictionary, Ref},
 1591:                                {dictionary, Int0},
 1592:                                async_dist,
 1593:                                trap_exit,
 1594:                                {dictionary, Pid},
 1595:                                {dictionary, Tuple},
 1596:                                {dictionary, Bin}]),
 1597:     ct:log("PIRes = ~p", [PIRes]),
 1598:     PIRes = [{async_dist, AsyncDist},
 1599:              {trap_exit, false},
 1600:              {{dictionary, hej}, hopp},
 1601:              {{dictionary, hopp}, hej},
 1602:              {{dictionary, Ref}, Int0},
 1603:              {{dictionary, Int0}, Int1},
 1604:              {async_dist, AsyncDist},
 1605:              {trap_exit, false},
 1606:              {{dictionary, Pid}, Ref},
 1607:              {{dictionary, Tuple}, Bin},
 1608:              {{dictionary, Bin}, Ref}],
 1609: 
 1610:     pdh(Pid, erase_async, [hej]),
 1611:     pdh(Pid, erase_async, [hopp]),
 1612:     pdh(Pid, erase_async, [Ref]),
 1613:     pdh(Pid, erase_async, [Int0]),
 1614:     pdh(Pid, erase_async, [Pid]),
 1615:     pdh(Pid, erase_async, [Tuple]),
 1616:     Ref = pdh(Pid, erase, [Bin]),
 1617: 
 1618:     erlang:garbage_collect(Pid),
 1619: 
 1620:     {{dictionary, Ref}, undefined} = process_info(Pid, {dictionary, Ref}),
 1621:     [{{dictionary, Ref}, undefined}] = process_info(Pid, [{dictionary, Ref}]),
 1622: 
 1623:     PIRes2 = process_info(Pid, [async_dist,
 1624:                                 trap_exit,
 1625:                                 {dictionary, hej},
 1626:                                 {dictionary, hopp},
 1627:                                 {dictionary, Ref},
 1628:                                 {dictionary, Int0},
 1629:                                 async_dist,
 1630:                                 trap_exit,
 1631:                                 {dictionary, Pid},
 1632:                                 {dictionary, Tuple},
 1633:                                 {dictionary, Bin}]),
 1634:     ct:log("PIRes2 = ~p", [PIRes2]),
 1635: 
 1636:     PIRes2 = [{async_dist, AsyncDist},
 1637:              {trap_exit, false},
 1638:              {{dictionary, hej}, undefined},
 1639:              {{dictionary, hopp}, undefined},
 1640:              {{dictionary, Ref}, undefined},
 1641:              {{dictionary, Int0}, undefined},
 1642:              {async_dist, AsyncDist},
 1643:              {trap_exit, false},
 1644:              {{dictionary, Pid}, undefined},
 1645:              {{dictionary, Tuple}, undefined},
 1646:              {{dictionary, Bin}, undefined}],
 1647: 
 1648:     unlink(Pid),
 1649:     exit(Pid,kill),
 1650: 
 1651:     %% Also check that it works on ourself...
 1652: 
 1653:     put(hej, hopp),
 1654:     put(hopp, hej),
 1655:     put(Ref, Int0),
 1656:     put(Int0, Int1),
 1657:     put(Pid, Ref),
 1658:     put(Tuple, Bin),
 1659:     undefined = put(Bin, Ref),
 1660: 
 1661:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
 1662: 
 1663:     {{dictionary, Ref}, Int0} = process_info(self(), {dictionary, Ref}),
 1664:     [{{dictionary, Ref}, Int0}] = process_info(self(), [{dictionary, Ref}]),
 1665: 
 1666:     PIRes3 = process_info(self(), [async_dist,
 1667:                                    trap_exit,
 1668:                                    {dictionary, hej},
 1669:                                    {dictionary, hopp},
 1670:                                    {dictionary, Ref},
 1671:                                    {dictionary, Int0},
 1672:                                    async_dist,
 1673:                                    trap_exit,
 1674:                                    {dictionary, Pid},
 1675:                                    {dictionary, Tuple},
 1676:                                    {dictionary, Bin}]),
 1677:     ct:log("PIRes3 = ~p", [PIRes3]),
 1678:     PIRes3 = [{async_dist, AsyncDist},
 1679:               {trap_exit, false},
 1680:               {{dictionary, hej}, hopp},
 1681:               {{dictionary, hopp}, hej},
 1682:               {{dictionary, Ref}, Int0},
 1683:               {{dictionary, Int0}, Int1},
 1684:               {async_dist, AsyncDist},
 1685:               {trap_exit, false},
 1686:               {{dictionary, Pid}, Ref},
 1687:               {{dictionary, Tuple}, Bin},
 1688:               {{dictionary, Bin}, Ref}],
 1689: 
 1690:     erase(hej),
 1691:     erase(hopp),
 1692:     erase(Ref),
 1693:     erase(Int0),
 1694:     erase(Pid),
 1695:     erase(Tuple),
 1696:     Ref = erase(Bin),
 1697: 
 1698:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
 1699: 
 1700:     {{dictionary, Ref}, undefined} = process_info(self(), {dictionary, Ref}),
 1701:     [{{dictionary, Ref}, undefined}] = process_info(self(), [{dictionary, Ref}]),
 1702: 
 1703:     PIRes4 = process_info(self(), [async_dist,
 1704:                                    trap_exit,
 1705:                                    {dictionary, hej},
 1706:                                    {dictionary, hopp},
 1707:                                    {dictionary, Ref},
 1708:                                    {dictionary, Int0},
 1709:                                    async_dist,
 1710:                                    trap_exit,
 1711:                                    {dictionary, Pid},
 1712:                                    {dictionary, Tuple},
 1713:                                    {dictionary, Bin}]),
 1714:     ct:log("PIRes4 = ~p", [PIRes4]),
 1715: 
 1716:     PIRes4 = [{async_dist, AsyncDist},
 1717:               {trap_exit, false},
 1718:               {{dictionary, hej}, undefined},
 1719:               {{dictionary, hopp}, undefined},
 1720:               {{dictionary, Ref}, undefined},
 1721:               {{dictionary, Int0}, undefined},
 1722:               {async_dist, AsyncDist},
 1723:               {trap_exit, false},
 1724:               {{dictionary, Pid}, undefined},
 1725:               {{dictionary, Tuple}, undefined},
 1726:               {{dictionary, Bin}, undefined}],
 1727: 
 1728:     false = is_process_alive(Pid),
 1729:     ok.
 1730: 
 1731: pdh(Pid, AsyncOp, Args) when AsyncOp == put_async;
 1732:                              AsyncOp == erase_async ->
 1733:     Pid ! {AsyncOp, Args},
 1734:     ok;
 1735: pdh(Pid, SyncOp, Args) ->
 1736:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1737:     Pid ! {SyncOp, self(), Ref, Args},
 1738:     receive {Ref, Res} -> Res end.
 1739: 
 1740: proc_dict_helper() ->
 1741:     receive
 1742:         {put, From, Ref, [Key, Value]} ->
 1743:             From ! {Ref, put(Key, Value)};
 1744:         {get, From, Ref, [Key]} ->
 1745:             From ! {Ref, get(Key)};
 1746:         {get, From, Ref, []} ->
 1747:             From ! {Ref, get()};
 1748:         {erase, From, Ref, [Key]} ->
 1749:             From ! {Ref, erase(Key)};
 1750:         {put_async, [Key, Value]} ->
 1751:             _ = put(Key, Value);
 1752:         {erase_async, [Key]} ->
 1753:             _ = erase(Key)
 1754:     end,
 1755:     proc_dict_helper().
 1756: 
 1757: %% Tests erlang:bump_reductions/1.
 1758: bump_reductions(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1759:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
 1760:     erlang:yield(),		% Clear reductions.
 1761:     {reductions,R1} = process_info(self(), reductions),
 1762:     true = erlang:bump_reductions(100),
 1763:     {reductions,R2} = process_info(self(), reductions),
 1764:     case R2-R1 of
 1765: 	      Diff when Diff < 100 ->
 1766: 		  ok = io:format("R1 = ~w, R2 = ~w", [R1, R2]),
 1767: 		  ct:fail({small_diff, Diff});
 1768: 	      Diff when Diff > 110 ->
 1769: 		  ok = io:format("R1 = ~w, R2 = ~w", [R1, R2]),
 1770: 		  ct:fail({big_diff, Diff});
 1771: 	      Diff ->
 1772: 		  io:format("~p\n", [Diff]),
 1773: 		  ok
 1774: 	  end,
 1775: 
 1776:     %% Make sure that a bignum reduction doesn't crash the emulator (32-bit CPU).
 1777:     bump_big(R2, 16#08000000).
 1778: 
 1779: bump_big(Prev, Limit) ->
 1780:     true = erlang:bump_reductions(100000), %Limited to CONTEXT_REDUCTIONS.
 1781:     case process_info(self(), reductions) of
 1782: 	      {reductions,Big} when is_integer(Big), Big > Limit ->
 1783: 		  erlang:garbage_collect(),
 1784: 		  io:format("~p\n", [Big]);
 1785: 	      {reductions,R} when is_integer(R), R > Prev ->
 1786: 		  bump_big(R, Limit)
 1787: 	  end,
 1788:     ok.
 1789: 
 1790: %% Priority 'low' should be mixed with 'normal' using a factor of
 1791: %% about 8. (OTP-2644)
 1792: low_prio(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1793:     erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, block_normal),
 1794:     Prop = low_prio_test(Config),
 1795:     erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, unblock_normal),
 1796:     Str = lists:flatten(io_lib:format("Low/high proportion is ~.3f",
 1797:                                       [Prop])),
 1798:     {comment,Str}.
 1799: 
 1800: low_prio_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1801:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1802: 
 1803:     %% Spawn the server running with high priority. The server must
 1804:     %% not run at normal priority as that would skew the results for
 1805:     %% two reasons:
 1806:     %%
 1807:     %% 1. There would be one more normal-priority processes than
 1808:     %% low-priority processes.
 1809:     %%
 1810:     %% 2. The receive queue would grow faster than the server process
 1811:     %% could process it. That would in turn trigger the reduction
 1812:     %% punishment for the clients.
 1813:     S = spawn_opt(?MODULE, prio_server, [0, 0], [link,{priority,high}]),
 1814: 
 1815:     %% Spawn the clients and let them run for a while.
 1816:     PCs = spawn_prio_clients(S, erlang:system_info(schedulers_online)),
 1817:     ct:sleep({seconds,2}),
 1818:     lists:foreach(fun (P) -> exit(P, kill) end, PCs),
 1819: 
 1820:     %% Stop the server and retrieve the result.
 1821:     S ! exit,
 1822:     receive
 1823:         {'EXIT', S, {A, B}} ->
 1824:             check_prio(A, B)
 1825:     end.
 1826: 
 1827: check_prio(A, B) ->
 1828:     Prop = A/B,
 1829:     ok = io:format("Low=~p, High=~p, Prop=~p\n", [A, B, Prop]),
 1830: 
 1831:     %% Prop is expected to be appr. 1/8. Allow a reasonable margin.
 1832:     true = Prop < 1/4,
 1833:     true = Prop > 1/16,
 1834:     Prop.
 1835: 
 1836: prio_server(A, B) ->
 1837:     receive
 1838: 	low ->
 1839: 	    prio_server(A+1, B);
 1840: 	normal ->
 1841: 	    prio_server(A, B+1);
 1842: 	exit ->
 1843: 	    exit({A, B})
 1844:     end.
 1845: 
 1846: spawn_prio_clients(_, 0) ->
 1847:     [];
 1848: spawn_prio_clients(S, N) ->
 1849:     [spawn_opt(?MODULE, prio_client, [S, normal], [link, {priority,normal}]),
 1850:      spawn_opt(?MODULE, prio_client, [S, low], [link, {priority,low}])
 1851:      | spawn_prio_clients(S, N-1)].
 1852: 
 1853: prio_client(S, Prio) ->
 1854:     S ! Prio,
 1855:     prio_client(S, Prio).
 1856: 
 1857: make_sub_binary(Bin) when is_binary(Bin) ->
 1858:     {_,B} = split_binary(list_to_binary([0,1,3,Bin]), 3),
 1859:     B;
 1860: make_sub_binary(List) ->
 1861:     make_sub_binary(list_to_binary(List)).
 1862: 
 1863: make_unaligned_sub_binary(Bin0) ->
 1864:     Bin1 = <<0:3,Bin0/binary,31:5>>,
 1865:     Sz = size(Bin0),
 1866:     <<0:3,Bin:Sz/binary,31:5>> = id(Bin1),
 1867:     Bin.
 1868: 
 1869: %% Tests erlang:yield/1
 1870: yield(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1871:     case catch erlang:system_info(modified_timing_level) of
 1872: 	Level when is_integer(Level) ->
 1873: 	    {skipped,
 1874: 	     "Modified timing (level " ++ integer_to_list(Level)
 1875: 	     ++ ") is enabled. Testcase gets messed up by modified "
 1876: 	     "timing."};
 1877: 	_ ->
 1878: 	    MS = erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, block_normal),
 1879: 	    yield_test(),
 1880: 	    erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, unblock_normal),
 1881: 	    case MS of
 1882: 		blocked ->
 1883: 		    {comment,
 1884: 		     "Multi-scheduling blocked during test. This test-case "
 1885: 		     "was not written to work with multiple schedulers (the "
 1886: 		     "yield2 test-case tests almost the same thing)."};
 1887: 		_ ->
 1888: 		    ok
 1889: 	    end
 1890:     end.
 1891: 
 1892: yield_test() ->
 1893:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
 1894:     receive after 1 -> ok end,		% Clear reductions.
 1895:     SC = schedcnt(start),
 1896:     {reductions, R1} = process_info(self(), reductions),
 1897:     {ok, true} = call_yield(middle),
 1898:     true = call_yield(final),
 1899:     true = call_yield(),
 1900:     true = apply(erlang, yield, []),
 1901:     {reductions, R2} = process_info(self(), reductions),
 1902:     Schedcnt = schedcnt(stop, SC),
 1903:     case {R2-R1, Schedcnt} of
 1904: 	{Diff, 4} when Diff < 30 ->
 1905: 	    ok = io:format("R1 = ~w, R2 = ~w, Schedcnt = ~w", 
 1906: 		[R1, R2, Schedcnt]);
 1907: 	{Diff, _} ->
 1908: 	    ok = io:format("R1 = ~w, R2 = ~w, Schedcnt = ~w", 
 1909: 		[R1, R2, Schedcnt]),
 1910: 	    ct:fail({measurement_error, Diff, Schedcnt})
 1911:     end.
 1912: 
 1913: call_yield() ->
 1914:     erlang:yield().
 1915: 
 1916: call_yield(middle) ->
 1917:     {ok, erlang:yield()};
 1918: call_yield(final) ->
 1919:     case self() of
 1920: 	Self when is_pid(Self) ->
 1921: 	    ok
 1922:     end,
 1923:     erlang:yield().
 1924: 
 1925: schedcnt(start) ->
 1926:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1927:     Fun = 
 1928: 	fun (F, Cnt) ->
 1929: 		receive
 1930: 		    {Ref, Parent} ->
 1931: 			Parent ! {Ref, Cnt}
 1932: 		after 0 ->
 1933: 			erlang:yield(),
 1934: 			F(F, Cnt+1)
 1935: 		end
 1936: 	end,
 1937:     Pid = spawn_link(fun () -> Fun(Fun, 0) end),
 1938:     {Ref, Pid}.
 1939: 
 1940: schedcnt(stop, {Ref, Pid}) when is_reference(Ref), is_pid(Pid) ->
 1941:     Pid ! {Ref, self()},
 1942:     receive
 1943: 	{Ref, Cnt} ->
 1944: 	    Cnt
 1945:     end.
 1946: 
 1947: yield2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1948:     Me = self(),
 1949:     Go = make_ref(),
 1950:     RedDiff = make_ref(),
 1951:     Done = make_ref(),
 1952:     P = spawn(fun () ->
 1953: 		receive Go -> ok end,
 1954: 		{reductions, R1} = process_info(self(), reductions),
 1955: 		{ok, true} = call_yield(middle),
 1956: 		true = call_yield(final),
 1957: 		true = call_yield(),
 1958: 		true = apply(erlang, yield, []),
 1959: 		{reductions, R2} = process_info(self(), reductions),
 1960: 		Me ! {RedDiff, R2 - R1},
 1961: 		exit(Done)
 1962: 	end),
 1963:     erlang:yield(),
 1964: 
 1965:     1 = erlang:trace(P, true, [running, procs, {tracer, self()}]),
 1966: 
 1967:     P ! Go,
 1968: 
 1969:     %% receive Go -> ok end,
 1970:     {trace, P, in, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 1971: 
 1972:     %% {ok, true} = call_yield(middle),
 1973:     {trace, P, out, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 1974:     {trace, P, in, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 1975: 
 1976:     %% true = call_yield(final),
 1977:     {trace, P, out, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 1978:     {trace, P, in, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 1979: 
 1980:     %% true = call_yield(),
 1981:     {trace, P, out, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 1982:     {trace, P, in, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 1983: 
 1984:     %% true = apply(erlang, yield, []),
 1985:     {trace, P, out, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 1986:     {trace, P, in, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 1987: 
 1988:     %% exit(Done)
 1989:     {trace, P, exit, Done} = next_tmsg(P),
 1990: 
 1991: 
 1992:     receive
 1993: 	      {RedDiff, Reductions} when Reductions < 30, Reductions > 0 ->
 1994: 		  io:format("Reductions = ~p~n", [Reductions]),
 1995: 		  ok;
 1996: 	      {RedDiff, Reductions} ->
 1997: 		  ct:fail({unexpected_reduction_count, Reductions})
 1998: 	  end,
 1999: 
 2000:     none = next_tmsg(P),
 2001: 
 2002:     ok.
 2003: 
 2004: next_tmsg(Pid) ->
 2005:     receive
 2006: 	TMsg when is_tuple(TMsg),
 2007: 		  element(1, TMsg) == trace,
 2008: 		  element(2, TMsg) == Pid ->
 2009: 	    TMsg
 2010:     after 100 ->
 2011: 	    none
 2012:     end.
 2013: 
 2014: dist_unlink_ack_exit_leak(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2015:     %% Verification of nc reference counts when stopping node
 2016:     %% will find the bug if it exists...
 2017:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 2018:     ParentFun =
 2019:         fun () ->
 2020:                 %% Give parent some work to do when
 2021:                 %% exiting to increase the likelyhood
 2022:                 %% of the bug triggereing...
 2023:                 T = ets:new(x,[]),
 2024:                 ets:insert(T, lists:map(fun (I) ->
 2025:                                                 {I,I}
 2026:                                         end,
 2027:                                         lists:seq(1,10000))),
 2028:                 Chld = spawn_link(Node,
 2029:                                   fun () ->
 2030:                                           receive
 2031:                                           after infinity ->
 2032:                                                   ok
 2033:                                           end
 2034:                                   end),
 2035:                 erlang:yield(),
 2036:                 unlink(Chld),
 2037:                 exit(bye)
 2038:         end,
 2039:     PMs = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 2040:                             spawn_monitor(ParentFun)
 2041:                     end, lists:seq(1, 10)),
 2042:     lists:foreach(fun ({P, M}) ->
 2043:                           receive
 2044:                               {'DOWN', M, process, P, bye} ->
 2045:                                   ok
 2046:                           end
 2047:                   end, PMs),
 2048:     stop_node(Peer, Node),
 2049:     ok.
 2050: 
 2051: %% Test that bad arguments to register/2 cause an exception.
 2052: bad_register(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2053:     Name = a_long_and_unused_name,
 2054: 
 2055:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch register({bad,name}, self())),
 2056:     fail_register(undefined, self()),
 2057:     fail_register([bad,name], self()),
 2058: 
 2059:     {Dead,Mref} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> true end),
 2060:     receive
 2061: 	{'DOWN',Mref,process,Dead,_} -> ok
 2062:     end,
 2063:     fail_register(Name, Dead),
 2064:     fail_register(Name, make_ref()),
 2065:     fail_register(Name, []),
 2066:     fail_register(Name, {bad,process}),
 2067:     fail_register(Name, <<>>),
 2068:     ok.
 2069: 
 2070: fail_register(Name, Process) ->
 2071:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch register(Name, Process)),
 2072:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch Name ! anything_goes),
 2073:     ok.
 2074: 
 2075: garbage_collect(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2076:     Prio = process_flag(priority, high),
 2077:     true = erlang:garbage_collect(),
 2078:     
 2079:     TokLoopers = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 2080: 		spawn_opt(fun tok_loop/0, [{priority, low}, link])
 2081: 	end, lists:seq(1, 10)),
 2082: 
 2083:     lists:foreach(fun (Pid) ->
 2084: 		Mon = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 2085: 		DownBefore = receive
 2086: 		    {'DOWN', Mon, _, _, _} ->
 2087: 			true
 2088: 		after 0 ->
 2089: 			false
 2090: 		end,
 2091: 		GC = erlang:garbage_collect(Pid),
 2092: 		DownAfter = receive
 2093: 		    {'DOWN', Mon, _, _, _} ->
 2094: 			true
 2095: 		after 0 ->
 2096: 			false
 2097: 		end,
 2098: 		true = erlang:demonitor(Mon),
 2099: 		case {DownBefore, DownAfter} of
 2100: 		    {true, _} -> false = GC;
 2101: 		    {false, false} -> true = GC;
 2102: 		    _ -> GC
 2103: 		end
 2104: 	end, processes()),
 2105: 
 2106:     lists:foreach(fun (Pid) ->
 2107: 		unlink(Pid),
 2108: 		exit(Pid, bang)
 2109: 	end, TokLoopers),
 2110:     process_flag(priority, Prio),
 2111:     ok.
 2112: 
 2113: %% This used to cause the nofrag emulator to dump core
 2114: process_info_messages(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2115:     process_info_messages_test(),
 2116:     ok.
 2117: 
 2118: process_info_messages_loop(0) -> ok;
 2119: process_info_messages_loop(N) -> process_info_messages_loop(N-1).
 2120: 
 2121: process_info_messages_send_my_msgs_to(Rcvr) ->
 2122:     receive
 2123: 	Msg ->
 2124: 	    Rcvr ! Msg,
 2125: 	    process_info_messages_send_my_msgs_to(Rcvr)
 2126:     after 0 ->
 2127: 	    ok
 2128:     end.
 2129: 
 2130: process_info_messages_test() ->
 2131:     Go = make_ref(),
 2132:     Done = make_ref(),
 2133:     Rcvr = self(),
 2134:     Rcvr2 = spawn_link(fun () ->
 2135: 		receive {Go, Rcvr} -> ok end,
 2136: 		garbage_collect(),
 2137: 		Rcvr ! {Done, self()}
 2138: 	end),
 2139:     Sndrs = lists:map(
 2140: 	fun (_) ->
 2141: 		spawn_link(fun () ->
 2142: 			    Rcvr ! {Go, self()},
 2143: 			    receive {Go, Rcvr} -> ok end,
 2144: 			    BigData = lists:seq(1, 1000),
 2145: 			    Rcvr ! BigData,
 2146: 			    Rcvr ! BigData,
 2147: 			    Rcvr ! BigData,
 2148: 			    Rcvr ! {Done, self()}
 2149: 		    end)
 2150: 	end, lists:seq(1, 10)),
 2151:     lists:foreach(fun (Sndr) -> receive {Go, Sndr} -> ok end end,
 2152: 			Sndrs),
 2153:     garbage_collect(),
 2154:     erlang:yield(),
 2155:     lists:foreach(fun (Sndr) -> Sndr ! {Go, self()} end, Sndrs),
 2156:     process_info_messages_loop(100000000),
 2157:     Msgs = process_info(self(), messages),
 2158:     lists:foreach(fun (Sndr) -> receive {Done, Sndr} -> ok end end,
 2159: 			Sndrs),
 2160:     garbage_collect(),
 2161:     Rcvr2 ! Msgs,
 2162:     process_info_messages_send_my_msgs_to(Rcvr2),
 2163:     Rcvr2 ! {Go, self()},
 2164:     garbage_collect(),
 2165:     receive {Done, Rcvr2} -> ok end,
 2166:     Msgs.
 2167: 
 2168: chk_badarg(Fun) ->
 2169:     try Fun(), exit(no_badarg) catch error:badarg -> ok end.
 2170: 
 2171: process_flag_badarg(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2172:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(gurka, banan) end),
 2173:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(trap_exit, gurka) end),
 2174:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(error_handler, 1) end),
 2175:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(fullsweep_after, gurka) end),
 2176:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(min_heap_size, gurka) end),
 2177:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(min_bin_vheap_size, gurka) end),
 2178:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(min_bin_vheap_size, -1) end),
 2179: 
 2180:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(max_heap_size, gurka) end),
 2181:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(max_heap_size, -1) end),
 2182:     chk_badarg(fun () ->
 2183:                        {_,Min} = process_info(self(), min_heap_size),
 2184:                        process_flag(max_heap_size, Min - 1)
 2185:                end),
 2186:     chk_badarg(fun () ->
 2187:                        {_,Min} = process_info(self(), min_heap_size),
 2188:                        process_flag(max_heap_size, #{size => Min - 1})
 2189:                end),
 2190:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(max_heap_size, #{}) end),
 2191:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(max_heap_size, #{ kill => true }) end),
 2192:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(max_heap_size, #{ size => 233,
 2193:                                                         kill => gurka }) end),
 2194:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(max_heap_size, #{ size => 233,
 2195:                                                         error_logger => gurka }) end),
 2196:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(max_heap_size, #{ size => 233,
 2197:                                                         include_shared_binaries => gurka}) end),
 2198:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(max_heap_size, #{ size => 233,
 2199:                                                         kill => true,
 2200:                                                         error_logger => gurka }) end),
 2201:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(max_heap_size, #{ size => 1 bsl 64 }) end),
 2202: 
 2203:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(priority, 4711) end),
 2204:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(save_calls, hmmm) end),
 2205:     {P,Mref} = spawn_monitor(fun () -> receive "in vain" -> no end end),
 2206:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(P, save_calls, hmmm) end),
 2207:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(gurka, save_calls, hmmm) end),
 2208:     exit(P, die),
 2209:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(P, save_calls, 0) end),
 2210:     {'DOWN', Mref, process, P, die} = receive M -> M end,
 2211:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(P, save_calls, 0) end),
 2212:     ok.
 2213: 
 2214: -include_lib("stdlib/include/ms_transform.hrl").
 2215: 
 2216: otp_6237(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2217:     Slctrs = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 2218: 		spawn_link(fun () ->
 2219: 			    otp_6237_select_loop()
 2220: 		    end)
 2221: 	end,
 2222: 	lists:seq(1,5)),
 2223:     lists:foreach(fun (_) -> otp_6237_test() end, lists:seq(1, 100)),
 2224:     lists:foreach(fun (S) -> unlink(S),exit(S, kill) end, Slctrs), 
 2225:     ok.
 2226: 				
 2227: otp_6237_test() ->
 2228:     Parent = self(),
 2229:     Inited = make_ref(),
 2230:     Die = make_ref(),
 2231:     Pid = spawn_link(fun () ->
 2232: 		register(otp_6237,self()),
 2233: 		otp_6237 = ets:new(otp_6237,
 2234: 		    [named_table,
 2235: 			ordered_set]),
 2236: 		ets:insert(otp_6237,
 2237: 		    [{I,I}
 2238: 			|| I <- lists:seq(1, 100)]),
 2239: 		%% Inserting a lot of bif timers
 2240: 		%% increase the possibility that
 2241: 		%% the test will fail when the
 2242: 		%% original cleanup order is used
 2243: 		lists:foreach( fun (_) ->
 2244: 			    erlang:send_after(1000000, self(), {a,b,c})
 2245: 		    end, lists:seq(1,1000)),
 2246: 		Parent ! Inited,
 2247: 		receive Die -> bye end
 2248: 	end),
 2249:     receive
 2250: 	Inited -> ok
 2251:     end,
 2252:     Pid ! Die,
 2253:     otp_6237_whereis_loop().
 2254: 
 2255: otp_6237_whereis_loop() ->
 2256:     case whereis(otp_6237) of
 2257: 	      undefined ->
 2258: 		  otp_6237 = ets:new(otp_6237,
 2259: 					   [named_table,ordered_set]),
 2260: 		  ets:delete(otp_6237),
 2261: 		  ok;
 2262: 	      _ ->
 2263: 		  otp_6237_whereis_loop()
 2264: 	  end.
 2265: 	     
 2266: otp_6237_select_loop() ->
 2267:     catch ets:select(otp_6237, ets:fun2ms(fun({K, does_not_exist}) -> K end)),
 2268:     otp_6237_select_loop().
 2269: 
 2270: 
 2271: -define(NoTestProcs, 10000).
 2272: -record(ptab_list_bif_info, {min_start_reds,
 2273: 			     tab_chunks,
 2274: 			     tab_chunks_size,
 2275: 			     tab_indices_per_red,
 2276: 			     free_term_proc_reds,
 2277: 			     term_procs_per_red,
 2278: 			     term_procs_max_reds,
 2279: 			     conses_per_red,
 2280: 			     debug_level}).
 2281: 
 2282: processes_large_tab(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2283:     sys_mem_cond_run(2048, fun () -> processes_large_tab_test() end).
 2284: 
 2285: processes_large_tab_test() ->
 2286:     enable_internal_state(),
 2287:     MaxDbgLvl = 20,
 2288:     MinProcTabSize = 2*(1 bsl 15),
 2289:     ProcTabSize0 = 1000000,
 2290:     ProcTabSize1 = case {erlang:system_info(schedulers_online),
 2291: 	    erlang:system_info(logical_processors)} of
 2292: 	{Schdlrs, Cpus} when is_integer(Cpus),
 2293: 	Schdlrs =< Cpus ->
 2294: 	    ProcTabSize0;
 2295: 	_ ->
 2296: 	    ProcTabSize0 div 4
 2297:     end,
 2298:     BT = erlang:system_info(build_type),
 2299:     ProcTabSize2 = case (BT =:= debug) or (BT =:= valgrind) of
 2300: 	true -> ProcTabSize1 - 500000;
 2301: 	false -> ProcTabSize1
 2302:     end,
 2303:     %% With high debug levels this test takes so long time that
 2304:     %% the connection times out; therefore, shrink the test on
 2305:     %% high debug levels.
 2306:     DbgLvl = case erts_debug:get_internal_state(processes_bif_info) of
 2307: 		       #ptab_list_bif_info{debug_level = Lvl} when Lvl > MaxDbgLvl ->
 2308: 			   20;
 2309: 		       #ptab_list_bif_info{debug_level = Lvl} when Lvl < 0 ->
 2310: 			   ct:fail({debug_level, Lvl});
 2311: 		       #ptab_list_bif_info{debug_level = Lvl} ->
 2312: 			   Lvl
 2313: 		   end,
 2314:     ProcTabSize3 = ProcTabSize2 - (1300000 * DbgLvl div MaxDbgLvl),
 2315:     ProcTabSize = case ProcTabSize3 < MinProcTabSize of
 2316: 			    true -> MinProcTabSize;
 2317: 			    false -> ProcTabSize3
 2318: 			end,
 2319:     {ok, Peer, LargeNode} = ?CT_PEER(["+P", integer_to_list(ProcTabSize)]),
 2320:     Res = rpc:call(LargeNode, ?MODULE, processes_bif_test, []),
 2321:     case rpc:call(LargeNode,
 2322: 			erts_debug,
 2323: 			get_internal_state,
 2324: 			[processes_bif_info]) of
 2325: 	      #ptab_list_bif_info{tab_chunks = Chunks} when is_integer(Chunks),
 2326: 							    Chunks > 1 -> ok;
 2327: 	      PBInfo -> ct:fail(PBInfo)
 2328: 	  end,
 2329:     stop_node(Peer, LargeNode),
 2330:     chk_processes_bif_test_res(Res).
 2331: 
 2332: processes_default_tab(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2333:     sys_mem_cond_run(1024, fun () -> processes_default_tab_test() end).
 2334: 
 2335: processes_default_tab_test() ->
 2336:     {ok, Peer, DefaultNode} = ?CT_PEER(),
 2337:     Res = rpc:call(DefaultNode, ?MODULE, processes_bif_test, []),
 2338:     stop_node(Peer, DefaultNode),
 2339:     chk_processes_bif_test_res(Res).
 2340: 
 2341: processes_small_tab(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2342:     {ok, Peer, SmallNode} = ?CT_PEER(["+P","1024"]),
 2343:     Res    = rpc:call(SmallNode, ?MODULE, processes_bif_test, []),
 2344:     PBInfo = rpc:call(SmallNode, erts_debug, get_internal_state, [processes_bif_info]),
 2345:     stop_node(Peer, SmallNode),
 2346:     true = PBInfo#ptab_list_bif_info.tab_chunks < 10,
 2347:     chk_processes_bif_test_res(Res).
 2348: 
 2349: processes_this_tab(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2350:     Mem = case {erlang:system_info(build_type),
 2351:                 erlang:system_info(allocator)} of
 2352:               {lcnt, {_, _Vsn, [sys_alloc], _Opts}} ->
 2353:                   %% When running +Mea min + lcnt we may need more memory
 2354:                   1024 * 4;
 2355:               _ ->
 2356:                   1024
 2357:           end,
 2358:     sys_mem_cond_run(Mem, fun () -> chk_processes_bif_test_res(processes_bif_test()) end).
 2359: 
 2360: chk_processes_bif_test_res(ok) -> ok;
 2361: chk_processes_bif_test_res({comment, _} = Comment) -> Comment;
 2362: chk_processes_bif_test_res(Failure) -> ct:fail(Failure).
 2363: 
 2364: print_processes_bif_info(#ptab_list_bif_info{min_start_reds = MinStartReds,
 2365: 					     tab_chunks = TabChunks,
 2366: 					     tab_chunks_size = TabChunksSize,
 2367: 					     tab_indices_per_red = TabIndPerRed,
 2368: 					     free_term_proc_reds = FreeTPReds,
 2369: 					     term_procs_per_red = TPPerRed,
 2370: 					     term_procs_max_reds = TPMaxReds,
 2371: 					     conses_per_red = ConsesPerRed,
 2372: 					     debug_level = DbgLvl}) ->
 2373:     io:format("processes/0 bif info on node ~p:~n"
 2374: 	      "Min start reductions = ~p~n"
 2375: 	      "Process table chunks = ~p~n"
 2376: 	      "Process table chunks size = ~p~n"
 2377: 	      "Process table indices per reduction = ~p~n"
 2378: 	      "Reduction cost for free() on terminated process struct = ~p~n"
 2379: 	      "Inspect terminated processes per reduction = ~p~n"
 2380: 	      "Max reductions during inspection of terminated processes = ~p~n"
 2381: 	      "Create cons-cells per reduction = ~p~n"
 2382: 	      "Debug level = ~p~n",
 2383: 	      [node(),
 2384: 	       MinStartReds,
 2385: 	       TabChunks,
 2386: 	       TabChunksSize,
 2387: 	       TabIndPerRed,
 2388: 	       FreeTPReds,
 2389: 	       TPPerRed,
 2390: 	       TPMaxReds,
 2391: 	       ConsesPerRed,
 2392: 	       DbgLvl]).
 2393: 
 2394: processes_bif_cleaner() ->
 2395:     receive {'EXIT', _, _} -> ok end,
 2396:     processes_bif_cleaner().
 2397: 
 2398: spawn_initial_hangarounds(Cleaner) ->
 2399:     TabSz = erlang:system_info(process_limit),
 2400:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(next_pid,TabSz),
 2401:     spawn_initial_hangarounds(Cleaner,
 2402: 			      TabSz,
 2403: 			      TabSz*2,
 2404: 			      0,
 2405: 			      []).
 2406: 
 2407: processes_unexpected_result(CorrectProcs, Procs) ->
 2408:     ProcInfo = [registered_name,
 2409: 		initial_call,
 2410: 		current_function,
 2411: 		status,
 2412: 		priority],
 2413:     MissingProcs = CorrectProcs -- Procs,
 2414:     io:format("Missing processes: ~p",
 2415: 	      [lists:map(fun (Pid) ->
 2416: 				 [{pid, Pid}
 2417: 				  | case process_info(Pid, ProcInfo) of
 2418: 					undefined -> [];
 2419: 					Res -> Res
 2420: 				    end]
 2421: 			 end,
 2422: 			 MissingProcs)]),
 2423:     SuperfluousProcs = Procs -- CorrectProcs,
 2424:     io:format("Superfluous processes: ~p",
 2425: 	      [lists:map(fun (Pid) ->
 2426: 				 [{pid, Pid}
 2427: 				  | case process_info(Pid, ProcInfo) of
 2428: 					undefined -> [];
 2429: 					Res -> Res
 2430: 				    end]
 2431: 			 end,
 2432: 			 SuperfluousProcs)]),
 2433:     ct:fail(unexpected_result).
 2434: 
 2435: hangaround(Cleaner, Type) ->
 2436:     %% Type is only used to distinguish different processes from
 2437:     %% when doing process_info
 2438:     try link(Cleaner) catch error:Reason -> exit(Reason) end,
 2439:     receive after infinity -> ok end,
 2440:     exit(Type).
 2441: 
 2442: spawn_initial_hangarounds(_Cleaner, NP, Max, Len, HAs) when NP > Max ->
 2443:     {Len, HAs};
 2444: spawn_initial_hangarounds(Cleaner, NP, Max, Len, HAs) ->
 2445:     Skip = 30,
 2446:     wait_for_proc_slots(Skip+3),
 2447:     HA1 = spawn_opt(?MODULE, hangaround, [Cleaner, initial_hangaround],
 2448: 		    [{priority, low}]),
 2449:     HA2 = spawn_opt(?MODULE, hangaround, [Cleaner, initial_hangaround],
 2450: 		    [{priority, normal}]),
 2451:     HA3 = spawn_opt(?MODULE, hangaround, [Cleaner, initial_hangaround],
 2452: 		    [{priority, high}]),
 2453:     spawn_drop(Skip),
 2454:     spawn_initial_hangarounds(Cleaner, NP+Skip, Max, Len+3, [HA1,HA2,HA3|HAs]).
 2455: 
 2456: wait_for_proc_slots(MinFreeSlots) ->
 2457:     case erlang:system_info(process_limit) - erlang:system_info(process_count) of
 2458:         FreeSlots when FreeSlots < MinFreeSlots ->
 2459:             receive after 10 -> ok end,
 2460:             wait_for_proc_slots(MinFreeSlots);
 2461:         _FreeSlots ->
 2462:             ok
 2463:     end.
 2464: 
 2465: spawn_drop(N) when N =< 0 ->
 2466:     ok;
 2467: spawn_drop(N) ->
 2468:     spawn(fun () -> ok end),
 2469:     spawn_drop(N-1).
 2470: 
 2471: do_processes(WantReds) ->
 2472:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(reds_left, WantReds),
 2473:     processes().
 2474: 
 2475: processes_bif_test() ->
 2476:     Tester = self(),
 2477:     enable_internal_state(),
 2478:     PBInfo = erts_debug:get_internal_state(processes_bif_info),
 2479:     print_processes_bif_info(PBInfo),
 2480:     WantReds = PBInfo#ptab_list_bif_info.min_start_reds + 10,
 2481:     WillTrap = case PBInfo of
 2482: 	#ptab_list_bif_info{tab_chunks = Chunks} when Chunks < 10 ->
 2483: 	    false; %% Skip for small tables
 2484: 	#ptab_list_bif_info{tab_chunks = Chunks,
 2485: 	    tab_chunks_size = ChunksSize,
 2486: 	    tab_indices_per_red = IndiciesPerRed
 2487: 	} ->
 2488: 	    Chunks*ChunksSize >= IndiciesPerRed*WantReds
 2489:     end,
 2490:     Processes = fun () ->
 2491: 	    erts_debug:set_internal_state(reds_left,WantReds),
 2492: 	    processes()
 2493:     end,
 2494: 
 2495:     ok = do_processes_bif_test(WantReds, WillTrap, Processes),
 2496: 
 2497:     case WillTrap of
 2498: 	false ->
 2499: 	    ok;
 2500: 	true ->
 2501: 	    %% Do it against with a process suspended while
 2502: 	    %% in the processes/0 bif.
 2503: 	    erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, block_normal),
 2504: 	    Suspendee = spawn_link(fun () ->
 2505: 						 Tester ! {suspend_me, self()},
 2506: 						 Tester ! {self(),
 2507: 							   done,
 2508: 							   hd(Processes())},
 2509: 						 receive
 2510: 						 after infinity ->
 2511: 							 ok
 2512: 						 end
 2513: 					 end),
 2514: 	    receive {suspend_me, Suspendee} -> ok end,
 2515: 	    erlang:suspend_process(Suspendee),
 2516: 	    erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, unblock_normal),
 2517: 	    
 2518: 	    [{status,suspended},{current_function,{erlang,ptab_list_continue,2}}] =
 2519: 		process_info(Suspendee, [status, current_function]),
 2520: 
 2521: 	    ok = do_processes_bif_test(WantReds, WillTrap, Processes),
 2522: 	    
 2523: 	    erlang:resume_process(Suspendee),
 2524: 	    receive {Suspendee, done, _} -> ok end,
 2525: 	    unlink(Suspendee),
 2526: 	    exit(Suspendee, bang)
 2527:     end,
 2528:     case get(processes_bif_testcase_comment) of
 2529: 	undefined -> ok;
 2530: 	Comment -> {comment, Comment}
 2531:     end.
 2532:     
 2533: do_processes_bif_test(WantReds, DieTest, Processes) ->
 2534:     Tester = self(),
 2535:     SpawnProcesses = fun (Prio) ->
 2536: 	    spawn_opt(?MODULE, do_processes, [WantReds], [link, {priority, Prio}])
 2537:     end,
 2538:     Cleaner = spawn_link(fun () ->
 2539: 		process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 2540: 		Tester ! {cleaner_alive, self()},
 2541: 		processes_bif_cleaner()
 2542: 	end),
 2543:     receive {cleaner_alive, Cleaner} -> ok end,
 2544:     try
 2545: 	DoIt = make_ref(),
 2546: 	GetGoing = make_ref(),
 2547: 	{NoTestProcs, TestProcs} = spawn_initial_hangarounds(Cleaner),
 2548: 	io:format("Testing with ~p processes~n", [NoTestProcs]),
 2549: 	SpawnHangAround = fun () ->
 2550: 		spawn(?MODULE, hangaround, [Cleaner, new_hangaround])
 2551: 	end,
 2552: 	Killer = spawn_opt(fun () ->
 2553: 		    Splt = NoTestProcs div 10,
 2554: 		    {TP1, TP23} = lists:split(Splt, TestProcs),
 2555: 		    {TP2, TP3} = lists:split(Splt, TP23),
 2556: 		    erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, block_normal),
 2557: 		    Tester ! DoIt,
 2558: 		    receive GetGoing -> ok end,
 2559: 		    erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, unblock_normal),
 2560: 		    SpawnProcesses(high),
 2561: 		    lists:foreach( fun (P) ->
 2562: 				SpawnHangAround(),
 2563: 				exit(P, bang)
 2564: 			end, TP1),
 2565: 		    SpawnProcesses(high),
 2566: 		    erlang:yield(),
 2567: 		    lists:foreach( fun (P) ->
 2568: 				SpawnHangAround(),
 2569: 				exit(P, bang)
 2570: 			end, TP2),
 2571: 		    SpawnProcesses(high),
 2572: 		    lists:foreach(
 2573: 			fun (P) ->
 2574: 				SpawnHangAround(),
 2575: 				exit(P, bang)
 2576: 			end, TP3)
 2577: 	    end, [{priority, high}, link]),
 2578: 	receive DoIt -> ok end,
 2579: 	process_flag(priority, low),
 2580: 	SpawnProcesses(low),
 2581: 	erlang:yield(),
 2582: 	process_flag(priority, normal),
 2583: 	CorrectProcs0 = erts_debug:get_internal_state(processes),
 2584: 	Killer ! GetGoing,
 2585: 	erts_debug:set_internal_state(reds_left, WantReds),
 2586: 	Procs0 = processes(),
 2587: 	Procs = lists:sort(Procs0),
 2588: 	CorrectProcs = lists:sort(CorrectProcs0),
 2589: 	LengthCorrectProcs = length(CorrectProcs),
 2590: 	io:format("~p = length(CorrectProcs)~n", [LengthCorrectProcs]),
 2591: 	true = LengthCorrectProcs > NoTestProcs,
 2592: 	case CorrectProcs =:= Procs of
 2593: 	    true ->
 2594: 		ok;
 2595: 	    false ->
 2596: 		processes_unexpected_result(CorrectProcs, Procs)
 2597: 	end,
 2598: 	unlink(Killer),
 2599: 	exit(Killer, bang)
 2600:     after
 2601: 	unlink(Cleaner),
 2602:         exit(Cleaner, kill),
 2603:         %% Wait for the system to recover to a normal state...
 2604: 	wait_until_system_recover()
 2605:     end,
 2606:     do_processes_bif_die_test(DieTest, Processes),
 2607:     ok.
 2608: 
 2609: 
 2610: do_processes_bif_die_test(false, _Processes) ->
 2611:     io:format("Skipping test killing process executing processes/0~n",[]),
 2612:     ok;
 2613: do_processes_bif_die_test(true, Processes) ->
 2614:     do_processes_bif_die_test(5, Processes);
 2615: do_processes_bif_die_test(N, Processes) ->
 2616:     io:format("Doing test killing process executing processes/0~n",[]),
 2617:     try
 2618: 	Tester = self(),
 2619: 	Oooh_Nooooooo = make_ref(),
 2620: 	{_, DieWhileDoingMon} = erlang:spawn_monitor( fun () ->
 2621: 		    Victim = self(),
 2622: 		    spawn_opt(
 2623: 			fun () ->
 2624: 				exit(Victim, got_him)
 2625: 			end,
 2626: 			[link, {priority, max}]),
 2627: 		    Tester ! {Oooh_Nooooooo,
 2628: 			hd(Processes())},
 2629: 		    exit(ohhhh_nooooo)
 2630: 	    end),
 2631: 	receive
 2632: 	    {'DOWN', DieWhileDoingMon, _, _, Reason} ->
 2633: 		case Reason of
 2634: 		    got_him -> ok;
 2635: 		    _ -> throw({kill_in_trap, Reason})
 2636: 		end
 2637: 	end,
 2638: 	receive
 2639: 	    {Oooh_Nooooooo, _} ->
 2640: 		throw({kill_in_trap, 'Oooh_Nooooooo'})
 2641: 	after 0 ->
 2642: 		ok
 2643: 	end,
 2644: 	PrcsCllrsSeqLen = 2*erlang:system_info(schedulers_online),
 2645: 	PrcsCllrsSeq = lists:seq(1, PrcsCllrsSeqLen),
 2646: 	ProcsCallers = lists:map( fun (_) ->
 2647: 		    spawn_link(
 2648: 			fun () ->
 2649: 				Tester ! hd(Processes())
 2650: 			end)
 2651: 	    end, PrcsCllrsSeq),
 2652: 	erlang:yield(),
 2653: 	{ProcsCallers1, ProcsCallers2} = lists:split(PrcsCllrsSeqLen div 2,
 2654: 						     ProcsCallers),
 2655: 	process_flag(priority, high),
 2656: 	lists:foreach(
 2657: 		fun (P) ->
 2658: 			unlink(P),
 2659: 			exit(P, bang)
 2660: 		end,
 2661: 		lists:reverse(ProcsCallers2) ++ ProcsCallers1),
 2662: 	process_flag(priority, normal),
 2663: 	ok
 2664:     catch
 2665: 	throw:{kill_in_trap, R} when N > 0 ->
 2666: 	    io:format("Failed to kill in trap: ~p~n", [R]),
 2667: 	    io:format("Trying again~n", []),
 2668: 	    do_processes_bif_die_test(N-1, Processes)
 2669:     end.
 2670: 	    
 2671: 
 2672: wait_until_system_recover() ->
 2673:     %% If system hasn't recovered after 10 seconds we give up
 2674:     Tmr = erlang:start_timer(10000, self(), no_more_wait),
 2675:     wait_until_system_recover(Tmr).
 2676: 
 2677: wait_until_system_recover(Tmr) ->
 2678:     try
 2679: 	lists:foreach(fun (P) when P == self() ->
 2680: 			      ok;
 2681: 			  (P) ->
 2682: 			      case process_info(P, initial_call) of
 2683: 				  {initial_call,{?MODULE, _, _}} ->
 2684: 				      throw(wait);
 2685: 				  {initial_call,{_, _, _}} ->
 2686: 				      ok;
 2687: 				  undefined ->
 2688: 				      ok
 2689: 			      end
 2690: 		      end,
 2691: 		      processes())
 2692:     catch
 2693: 	throw:wait ->
 2694: 	    receive
 2695: 		{timeout, Tmr, _} ->
 2696: 		    Comment = "WARNING: Test processes still hanging around!",
 2697: 		    io:format("~s~n", [Comment]),
 2698: 		    put(processes_bif_testcase_comment, Comment),
 2699: 		    lists:foreach(
 2700: 		      fun (P) when P == self() ->
 2701: 			      ok;
 2702: 			  (P) ->
 2703: 			      case process_info(P, initial_call) of
 2704: 				  {initial_call,{?MODULE, _, _} = MFA} ->
 2705: 				      io:format("~p ~p~n", [P, MFA]);
 2706: 				  {initial_call,{_, _, _}} ->
 2707: 				      ok;
 2708: 				  undefined ->
 2709: 				      ok
 2710: 			      end
 2711: 		      end,
 2712: 		      processes())
 2713: 	    after 100 ->
 2714: 		    wait_until_system_recover(Tmr)
 2715: 	    end
 2716:     end,
 2717:     erlang:cancel_timer(Tmr),
 2718:     receive {timeout, Tmr, _} -> ok after 0 -> ok end,
 2719:     ok.
 2720: 
 2721: processes_last_call_trap(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2722:     enable_internal_state(),
 2723:     Processes = fun () -> processes() end,
 2724:     PBInfo = erts_debug:get_internal_state(processes_bif_info),
 2725:     print_processes_bif_info(PBInfo),
 2726:     WantReds = case PBInfo#ptab_list_bif_info.min_start_reds of
 2727: 	R when R > 10 -> R - 1;
 2728: 	_R -> 9
 2729:     end,
 2730:     lists:foreach(fun (_) ->
 2731: 		erts_debug:set_internal_state(reds_left,
 2732: 		    WantReds),
 2733: 		Processes(),
 2734: 		erts_debug:set_internal_state(reds_left,
 2735: 		    WantReds),
 2736: 		my_processes()
 2737: 	end,
 2738: 	lists:seq(1,100)).
 2739:     
 2740: my_processes() ->
 2741:     processes().
 2742: 
 2743: processes_apply_trap(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2744:     enable_internal_state(),
 2745:     PBInfo = erts_debug:get_internal_state(processes_bif_info),
 2746:     print_processes_bif_info(PBInfo),
 2747:     WantReds = case PBInfo#ptab_list_bif_info.min_start_reds of
 2748: 	R when R > 10 -> R - 1;
 2749: 	_R -> 9
 2750:     end,
 2751:     lists:foreach(fun (_) ->
 2752: 		erts_debug:set_internal_state(reds_left,
 2753: 		    WantReds),
 2754: 		apply(erlang, processes, [])
 2755: 	end, lists:seq(1,100)).
 2756: 
 2757: processes_gc_trap(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2758:     Tester = self(),
 2759:     enable_internal_state(),
 2760:     PBInfo = erts_debug:get_internal_state(processes_bif_info),
 2761:     print_processes_bif_info(PBInfo),
 2762:     WantReds = PBInfo#ptab_list_bif_info.min_start_reds + 10,
 2763:     Processes = fun () ->
 2764: 	    erts_debug:set_internal_state(reds_left,WantReds),
 2765: 	    processes()
 2766:     end,
 2767: 
 2768:     erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, block_normal),
 2769:     Suspendee = spawn_link(fun () ->
 2770: 					 Tester ! {suspend_me, self()},
 2771: 					 Tester ! {self(),
 2772: 						   done,
 2773: 						   hd(Processes())},
 2774: 					 receive after infinity -> ok end
 2775: 				 end),
 2776:     receive {suspend_me, Suspendee} -> ok end,
 2777:     erlang:suspend_process(Suspendee),
 2778:     erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, unblock_normal),
 2779: 	    
 2780:     [{status,suspended}, {current_function,{erlang,ptab_list_continue,2}}]
 2781: 	= process_info(Suspendee, [status, current_function]),
 2782: 
 2783:     erlang:garbage_collect(Suspendee),
 2784:     erlang:garbage_collect(Suspendee),
 2785: 	    
 2786:     erlang:resume_process(Suspendee),
 2787:     receive {Suspendee, done, _} -> ok end,
 2788:     erlang:garbage_collect(Suspendee),
 2789:     erlang:garbage_collect(Suspendee),
 2790: 
 2791:     unlink(Suspendee),
 2792:     exit(Suspendee, bang),
 2793:     ok.
 2794: 
 2795: process_flag_fullsweep_after(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2796:     {fullsweep_after, OldFSA} = process_info(self(), fullsweep_after),
 2797:     OldFSA = process_flag(fullsweep_after, 12345),
 2798:     {fullsweep_after, 12345} = process_info(self(), fullsweep_after),
 2799:     12345 = process_flag(fullsweep_after, 0),
 2800:     {fullsweep_after, 0} = process_info(self(), fullsweep_after),
 2801:     0 = process_flag(fullsweep_after, OldFSA),
 2802:     ok.
 2803: 
 2804: process_flag_heap_size(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2805:     HSize  = 2586,   % must be gc fib+ number
 2806:     VHSize = 318187, % must be gc fib+ number
 2807:     OldHmin = erlang:process_flag(min_heap_size, HSize),
 2808:     {min_heap_size, HSize} = erlang:process_info(self(), min_heap_size),
 2809:     OldVHmin = erlang:process_flag(min_bin_vheap_size, VHSize),
 2810:     {min_bin_vheap_size, VHSize} = erlang:process_info(self(), min_bin_vheap_size),
 2811:     HSize = erlang:process_flag(min_heap_size, OldHmin),
 2812:     VHSize = erlang:process_flag(min_bin_vheap_size, OldVHmin),
 2813:     ok.
 2814: 
 2815: %% test that max_heap_size is correctly handled when passed via command line
 2816: command_line_max_heap_size(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2817:     %% test maximum heap size
 2818:     HMax = case erlang:system_info(wordsize) of
 2819:                8 -> (1 bsl 59) - 1;
 2820:                4 -> (1 bsl 27) - 1
 2821:            end,
 2822:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["+hmax", integer_to_list(HMax)]),
 2823:     Pid = erlang:spawn(Node, fun () -> receive after infinity -> ok end end),
 2824:     {max_heap_size, #{size := HMax}} = rpc:call(Node, erlang, process_info, [Pid, max_heap_size]),
 2825:     peer:stop(Peer).
 2826: 
 2827: spawn_opt_heap_size(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2828:     HSize  = 987,   % must be gc fib+ number
 2829:     VHSize = 46422, % must be gc fib+ number
 2830:     Pid  = spawn_opt(fun () -> receive stop -> ok end end,
 2831: 	[{min_heap_size, HSize},{ min_bin_vheap_size, VHSize}]),
 2832:     {min_heap_size, HSize} = process_info(Pid, min_heap_size),
 2833:     {min_bin_vheap_size, VHSize} = process_info(Pid, min_bin_vheap_size),
 2834:     Pid ! stop,
 2835:     ok.
 2836: 
 2837: spawn_opt_max_heap_size(_Config) ->
 2838: 
 2839:     error_logger:add_report_handler(?MODULE, self()),
 2840: 
 2841:     %% flush any prior messages in error_logger
 2842:     Pid = spawn(fun() -> ok = nok end),
 2843:     receive
 2844:         {error, _, {emulator, _, [Pid|_]}} ->
 2845:             flush()
 2846:     end,
 2847: 
 2848:     spawn_opt_max_heap_size_do(fun oom_fun/1),
 2849: 
 2850:     io:format("Repeat tests with refc binaries\n",[]),
 2851: 
 2852:     spawn_opt_max_heap_size_do(fun oom_bin_fun/1),
 2853: 
 2854:     error_logger:delete_report_handler(?MODULE),
 2855:     ok.
 2856: 
 2857: spawn_opt_max_heap_size_do(OomFun) ->
 2858:     Max = 2024,
 2859:     %% Test that numerical limit works
 2860:     max_heap_size_test(Max, Max, true, true, OomFun),
 2861: 
 2862:     %% Test that map limit works
 2863:     max_heap_size_test(#{ size => Max }, Max, true, true, OomFun),
 2864: 
 2865:     %% Test that no kill is sent
 2866:     max_heap_size_test(#{ size => Max, kill => false }, Max, false, true, OomFun),
 2867: 
 2868:     %% Test that no error_logger report is sent
 2869:     max_heap_size_test(#{ size => Max, error_logger => false }, Max, true, false, OomFun),
 2870: 
 2871:     %% Test that system_flag works
 2872:     erlang:system_flag(max_heap_size, OomFun(#{ size => 0, kill => false,
 2873:                                                 error_logger => true})),
 2874:     max_heap_size_test(#{ size => Max }, Max, false, true, OomFun),
 2875:     max_heap_size_test(#{ size => Max, kill => true }, Max, true, true, OomFun),
 2876: 
 2877:     erlang:system_flag(max_heap_size, OomFun(#{ size => 0, kill => true,
 2878:                                                 error_logger => false})),
 2879:     max_heap_size_test(#{ size => Max }, Max, true, false, OomFun),
 2880:     max_heap_size_test(#{ size => Max, error_logger => true }, Max, true, true, OomFun),
 2881: 
 2882:     erlang:system_flag(max_heap_size, OomFun(#{ size => 1 bsl 16, kill => true,
 2883:                                                 error_logger => true})),
 2884:     max_heap_size_test(#{ }, 1 bsl 16, true, true, OomFun),
 2885: 
 2886:     erlang:system_flag(max_heap_size, #{ size => 0, kill => true,
 2887:                                          error_logger => true}),
 2888: 
 2889:     %% Test that ordinary case works as expected again
 2890:     max_heap_size_test(Max, Max, true, true, OomFun),
 2891:     ok.
 2892: 
 2893: 
 2894: mhs_spawn_opt(Option) when map_get(size, Option) > 0;
 2895:                            is_integer(Option) ->
 2896:     [{max_heap_size, Option}];
 2897: mhs_spawn_opt(_) ->
 2898:     [].
 2899: 
 2900: max_heap_size_test(Option, Size, Kill, ErrorLogger, OomFun) ->
 2901:     SpOpt = mhs_spawn_opt(OomFun(Option)),
 2902:     Pid = spawn_opt(fun()-> OomFun(run) end, SpOpt),
 2903:     {max_heap_size, MHSz} = erlang:process_info(Pid, max_heap_size),
 2904:     ct:log("Default: ~p~nOption: ~p~nProc: ~p~nSize = ~p~nSpOpt = ~p~n",
 2905:            [erlang:system_info(max_heap_size), Option, MHSz, Size, SpOpt]),
 2906: 
 2907:     #{ size := Size} = MHSz,
 2908: 
 2909:     Ref = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 2910:     if Kill ->
 2911:             receive
 2912:                 {'DOWN', Ref, process, Pid, Reason} ->
 2913:                     killed = Reason
 2914:             end;
 2915:        true ->
 2916:             ok
 2917:     end,
 2918:     if ErrorLogger ->
 2919:             receive
 2920:                 %% There must be at least one error message.
 2921:                 {error, _, {emulator, _, [Pid|_]}} ->
 2922:                     ok
 2923:             end;
 2924:        true ->
 2925:             ok
 2926:     end,
 2927:     if not Kill ->
 2928:             exit(Pid, die),
 2929:             receive
 2930:                 {'DOWN', Ref, process, Pid, die} ->
 2931:                     ok
 2932:             end,
 2933:             %% If the process was not killed, the limit may have
 2934:             %% been reached more than once and there may be
 2935:             %% more {error, ...} messages left.
 2936:             receive_error_messages(Pid);
 2937:        true ->
 2938:             ok
 2939:     end,
 2940: 
 2941:     %% Make sure that there are no unexpected messages.
 2942:     receive_unexpected().
 2943: 
 2944: oom_fun(Max) when is_integer(Max) -> Max;
 2945: oom_fun(Map) when is_map(Map)-> Map;
 2946: oom_fun(run) ->
 2947:     io:format("oom_fun() started\n",[]),
 2948:     oom_run_fun([], 100).
 2949: 
 2950: oom_run_fun(Acc0, 0) ->
 2951:     done;
 2952: oom_run_fun(Acc0, N) ->
 2953:     %% This is tail-recursive since the compiler is smart enough to figure
 2954:     %% out that a body-recursive variant never returns, and loops forever
 2955:     %% without keeping the list alive.
 2956:     timer:sleep(5),
 2957:     oom_run_fun([lists:seq(1, 1000) | Acc0], N-1).
 2958: 
 2959: oom_bin_fun(Max) when is_integer(Max) -> oom_bin_fun(#{size => Max});
 2960: oom_bin_fun(Map) when is_map(Map) -> Map#{include_shared_binaries => true};
 2961: oom_bin_fun(run) ->
 2962:     oom_bin_run_fun([], 10).
 2963: 
 2964: oom_bin_run_fun(Acc0, 0) ->
 2965:     done;
 2966: oom_bin_run_fun(Acc0, N) ->
 2967:     timer:sleep(5),
 2968:     oom_bin_run_fun([build_refc_bin(160, <<>>) | Acc0], N-1).
 2969: 
 2970: build_refc_bin(0, Acc) ->
 2971:     Acc;
 2972: build_refc_bin(N, Acc) ->
 2973:     build_refc_bin(N-1, <<Acc/binary, 0:(1000*8)>>).
 2974: 
 2975: 
 2976: receive_error_messages(Pid) ->
 2977:     receive
 2978:         {error, _, {emulator, _, [Pid|_]}} ->
 2979:             receive_error_messages(Pid)
 2980:     after 1000 ->
 2981:             ok
 2982:     end.
 2983: 
 2984: receive_unexpected() ->
 2985:     receive
 2986:         {info_report, _, _} ->
 2987:             %% May be an alarm message from os_mon. Ignore.
 2988:             receive_unexpected();
 2989:         M ->
 2990:             ct:fail({unexpected_message, M})
 2991:     after 10 ->
 2992:             ok
 2993:     end.
 2994: 
 2995: flush() ->
 2996:     receive
 2997:         _M -> flush()
 2998:     after 0 ->
 2999:             ok
 3000:     end.
 3001: 
 3002: %% error_logger report handler proxy
 3003: init(Pid) ->
 3004:     {ok, Pid}.
 3005: 
 3006: handle_event(Event, Pid) ->
 3007:     Pid ! Event,
 3008:     {ok, Pid}.
 3009: 
 3010: huge_arglist_child(A0, A1, A2, A3, A4, A5, A6, A7, A8, A9,

 3064: spawn_huge_arglist(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3065:     %% Huge in two different ways; encoded size and
 3066:     %% length...
 3067:     ArgListHead = [make_ref(),
 3068:                    lists:duplicate(1000000, $a),
 3069:                    <<1:8388608>>,
 3070:                    processes(),
 3071:                    erlang:ports(),
 3072:                    {hej, hopp},
 3073:                    <<17:8388608>>,
 3074:                    lists:duplicate(3000000, $x),
 3075:                    #{ a => 1, b => 2, c => 3, d => 4, e => 5}],
 3076:     ArgList = ArgListHead ++ lists:seq(1, 255 - length(ArgListHead)),
 3077: 
 3078:     io:format("size(term_to_binary(ArgList)) = ~p~n",
 3079:               [size(term_to_binary(ArgList))]),
 3080: 
 3081:     io:format("Testing spawn with huge argument list on local node...~n", []),
 3082:     spawn_huge_arglist_test(true, node(), ArgList),
 3083:     io:format("Testing spawn with huge argument list on local node with Node...~n", []),
 3084:     spawn_huge_arglist_test(false, node(), ArgList),
 3085:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 3086:     _ = rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, module_info, []),
 3087:     io:format("Testing spawn with huge argument list on remote node ~p...~n", [Node]),
 3088:     spawn_huge_arglist_test(false, Node, ArgList),
 3089:     stop_node(Peer, Node),
 3090:     ok.
 3091: 
 3092: spawn_huge_arglist_test(Local, Node, ArgList) ->
 3093: 
 3094:     R1 = case Local of
 3095:              true ->
 3096:                  spawn_request(?MODULE, huge_arglist_child, ArgList, [monitor]);
 3097:              false ->
 3098:                  spawn_request(Node, ?MODULE, huge_arglist_child, ArgList, [monitor])
 3099:          end,
 3100:     receive
 3101:         {spawn_reply, R1, ok, Pid1} ->
 3102:             Pid1 ! go,
 3103:             receive
 3104:                 {'DOWN', R1, process, Pid1, Reason1} ->
 3105:                     ArgList = Reason1
 3106:             end
 3107:     end,
 3108: 
 3109:     {Pid2, R2} = case Local of
 3110:                      true ->
 3111:                          spawn_monitor(?MODULE, huge_arglist_child, ArgList);
 3112:                      false ->
 3113:                          spawn_monitor(Node, ?MODULE, huge_arglist_child, ArgList)
 3114:                  end,
 3115:     Node = node(Pid2),
 3116:     Pid2 ! go,
 3117:     receive
 3118:         {'DOWN', R2, process, Pid2, Reason2} ->
 3119:             ArgList = Reason2
 3120:     end,
 3121:     
 3122:     {Pid3, R3} = case Local of
 3123:                      true ->
 3124:                          spawn_opt(?MODULE, huge_arglist_child, ArgList, [monitor]);
 3125:                      false ->
 3126:                          spawn_opt(Node, ?MODULE, huge_arglist_child, ArgList, [monitor])
 3127:                  end,
 3128:     Node = node(Pid3),
 3129:     Pid3 ! go,
 3130:     receive
 3131:         {'DOWN', R3, process, Pid3, Reason3} ->
 3132:             ArgList = Reason3
 3133:     end,
 3134: 
 3135:     OldTA = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 3136:     Pid4 = case Local of
 3137:                true ->
 3138:                    spawn_link(?MODULE, huge_arglist_child, ArgList);
 3139:                false ->
 3140:                    spawn_link(Node, ?MODULE, huge_arglist_child, ArgList)
 3141:            end,
 3142:     Node = node(Pid4),
 3143:     Pid4 ! go,
 3144:     receive
 3145:         {'EXIT', Pid4, Reason4} ->
 3146:             ArgList = Reason4
 3147:     end,
 3148: 
 3149:     true = process_flag(trap_exit, OldTA),
 3150: 
 3151:     Pid5 = case Local of
 3152:                true ->
 3153:                    spawn(?MODULE, huge_arglist_child, ArgList);
 3154:                false ->
 3155:                    spawn(Node, ?MODULE, huge_arglist_child, ArgList)
 3156:            end,
 3157:     Node = node(Pid5),
 3158:     R5 = erlang:monitor(process, Pid5),
 3159:     Pid5 ! go,
 3160:     receive
 3161:         {'DOWN', R5, process, Pid5, Reason5} ->
 3162:             ArgList = Reason5
 3163:     end,
 3164:     ok.
